column1: a gentle outswinger first up, no pace off the pitch, Shaw waits for it, drops it at his toes and takes off for an easy single even though the ball goes as far as where forward short leg would have been
full now, just outside off, Agarwal gets a small stride in and then leaves it alone

shorter, hardly carries to Watling as Agarwal resists the temptation to cut. This is quite an ordinary delivery, though. You can get away with it in Tests when the batsmen are just trying to get their eye in
was that the scrambled-seam inswinger? It starts straight and angles down, flicking the pad on its way to the keeper
finally gets the length right to draw Agarwal forward. The batsman gets the stride in, plays for outswing, but the ball carries straight on and hits the inside half of the bat
straighter, on a length, Agarwal has to defend, which he does
swing first up. Shaw not as watchful as Agarwal and looks for a bit of a drive just outside off. It shapes back in to hit the inside edge onto the pad
looks to go really full. In fact it is a full toss. Shaw looks to drive, gets a thick inside edge for a couple past short leg
the other one this time. Looks like angled away on purpose. Shaw defends and is beaten
Shaw right on the back foot to defend this length ball. More watchful now

that is what he looks for when he wants an lbw. Swinging delivery, starting just outside off, and shaping back in to middle and leg. Shaw is equal to it, even closes the face, places this past midwicket for a couple
mix-up. Pushed past point for what looks like an easy two, but Shaw makes a late call to send Agarwal back, who stumbles while turning. No further drama, though, as he makes it back in time
Shaw is not watching looseners sail past. Short, slightly wide, and Shaw climbs into it. Doesn't bother with keeping it down. Past point it goes
on a length, straight, and he is right behind it in defence
full, wide, awayswinger. A teaser, and Shaw doesn't get tempted
wide on the crease, makes him play at a wide outswinger, but Shaw has defended this solidly
wide on the crease again, and with no swing this time, he gets clipped away for an easy single off the toes
wide length ball, Agarwal has left it alone without fuss
good ball. On a length, middle and leg, shapes to swing, but pitches and seams away. Shaw is squared up in defence

edged away. That is another good ball from Boult. Pitched up, inviting a drive, Shaw goes after it, playing for the swing, but the ball seams away a touch after pitching. The edge is placed perfectly between the slips and the gully, though
slightly shorter, and Shaw drops back to defend it with an open face
oh the lbw ball. Perfect line, perfect length. everyone gets excited as Shaw's back lift goes up. The ball doesn't swing enough, though, to miss the inside edge. Shaw gets a single with it
beauty. Boult finally hitting his stride. Inswinger as it leaves his hand, Agarwal has to defend this around off, but after pitching it goes the other way. Just misses the outside edge
this one does swing back in, and Agarwal plays it watchfully back to Boult
short of a length, really slow off the surface, Shaw aborts any plans he might have to punch this through cover. Defended

and just like that, Southee brings out the perfect delivery. Half-volley outswinger, asking for a drive, but Shaw does it without moving his front foot. He is in no position to cover any swing there might be. And there is swing here. In a rare case, a half-volley has left the batsman squared up. Past the outside edge it goes to disturb his off stump. A fairly ordinary shot in the end, playing far in front of his body and searching for the ball with his hands. He is looking at the pitch suspiciously, but the pitch has done nothing untoward here
sighter for Pujara as this heads down the leg side
tries the scrambled-seam inswinger first up for Pujara, but he is good enough to cover it on a slow surface. Gets off the mark with a couple
wide length ball, left alone
short of a length, straight, Pujara defends from the crease
uppishly clipped away as it swings back in. Wide of short leg so he gets an easy couple
bouncer just to keep him honest. Agarwal ducks it. Just a reminder you can't keep plonking your front foot down
really full, but too wide to engage Agarwal
full, swinging in, pushed to cover
short of a length, outside off, Agarwal shoulders arms
goes wider on the crease, pitches this short of a length, the ball angles away, squaring up Agarwal, who manages to keep it down
wide outsiwnger, Pujara, not yet out of box-cricket mode, lets it be
gets closer to off with his line, but still not full enough to make Pujara consider a drive
fulller, straighter, but too straight, and it angles down the leg side. Pujara watches it all the way into Watling's gloves
wide on the crease, but the line is wide too, and left alone again
and now Southee tries that straight ball that Pujara is sometimes susceptible to. It hits the inside half of the bat but the surface is not fast enough to trouble him with this line
wide on the crease, really full, and straight. Pujara defends solidly
on a length, around off, good busy cricket from India as Agarwal tiups and runs even though the ball has not gone too far wide of cover
full and wide, not much swing, left alone by Pujara
wide full toss, Pujara is too watchful to take full toll. He opens the face on it, but can't beat the man at point
on a length, middle and leg, could go either way. That is where you want to be more often than not. This one goes with the angle, and Pujara is forward to defend it
wide on the crease, and gets some swing back in against that angle. Headed for off and middle, and Pujara gets enough of an inside edge on it
wide on the crease again, but this one starts wider and doesn't swing either. Left alone
wide outswinger, and you won't get Pujara to play at those
perfect outswinger from wide of the crease, but not quick enough. Pujara right forward to almost smother it
another good delivery. On a length, around off, pitches and holds its line instead of swinging away. Hits the inside half of the bat

another beauty from Southee. Stays around off, gets swing away, but Pujara plays it late, lets it hit the bat instead of going out to meet it. It hits the outside half of the bat but he is in no danger
wider this time, and Pujara leaves it alone again

just overpitches a little as Pujara keeps resisting all of Sothee's teasing deliveries. Well more than just a little. This is a plum full toss, and Pujara takes full toll this time, driving it straight of mid-on
on a length, around off, angling away, and left alone
fuller, closer to off, Agarwal has to play at it. He pushes at it defensively, but ends up timing it sweetly enough to get three straight of mid-off
full, just outside off, Pujara covers the line should it swing, but this one doesn't, and it sails by without bothering Pujara
short of a length, middle and off, and it cuts away off the seam. Pujara has a little bit of a dab at it. Beaten
and now he tries the full swinging delivery. Two things wrong with it: he overpitches, and the ball doesn't swing either. Pushed away straight of mid-on. Classic Test-match batting
outside off, and left alone
gentle straight delivery, clipped away off the pads towards long leg. Boult does well to charge from fine leg, and keep them down to one
Pujara pads up and is hit on the knee roll. Draws a bit of an appeal from New Zealand but it is too wide to interest the umpire
another leave, and this one goes straight on through to the keeper
too straight, and angles down the leg side
straight and making him play, which Pujara does defensively to square leg
too full, also down the leg side, concedes an easy single to long leg
length ball, sixth-stump line, left alone
short of a length, good bounce, hits the bat high as Pujara defends
looks for swing, but balls it wide. Pujara is happy to watch them through to the keeper's gloves

peach. Real peach. Gets his pace going, angles this one, on a length, around off, and then it swings away late to beat his bat and leave him squared up. Swings too much to take the edge or hit the off stump. Pujara is just playing for the angle. So actually pretty good batting
wider length ball, left alone
another leave to end a maiden first over on debut for Jamieson
slightly short of a length, around off, defended from the crease
nibbly little length ball around off, Agarwal has to wtach it till the end, defends with an open face

the nibble again. Outswinger around off, Agarwal has to play for that movement, but the ball pitches and nips back in, beating his attempt to get around the front pad. However, it nips too much to get him the lbw
straight again, and defended to leg this time
on a length, stump to stumps, defended to leg
swinging, full, teasing him, but Agarwal is not playing at wide deliveries either. Really watchful start from India
short of a length, angled in, dropped to leg for a quick single, which seems to have surprised Agarwal, who is a little slow to hit full speed. He puts a dive in to make it
nice bounce. From just short of a length, he gets this to rise towards Agarwal's face. He fends at it, and manages to keep it down
and he tries the old trick of pitching it up after showing him the short ball. Agarwal is equal to it, pushes this wide of cover, gets a single
wide on the crease, wide of the stumps, left alone as it only just straightens

and Pujara again has a bit of a nibble. This is the second time he has followed a shortish ball that he doesn't usually do. First one was off Boult. This shortish delivery holds its line after pitching, Pujara follows it wit his hands but doesn't commit too much to it. Beaten
extra bounce from short of a length. Defended uppishly by Pujara
just in front of length, outside off, but nipping in. Agarwal shoulders his arms, but the ball was fairly close to off stump
length ball on off, and angling in. Tries to work it leg-side, but bunts it instead. Early to the shot, was expecting a bit more pace off the deck
full outside off. Bit of swing away. Left alone
good length on middle, and worked off the back foot to midwicket. On his toes while playing that shot
fullish, and a bit of extra bounce surprises the batsman as he prepares to leave. The ball hits his bat as Agarwal plays a late defensive shot
good length, on off. Gauges the length early and then defends off the front foot towards point
back of a length, outside off, and climbing all the time. Watling collects it from above his head
full on middle, and going down leg as Pujara shuffles across the flick. Comfortably taken by the keeper

that's his first wicket! And what a peach of a delivery. Just the fullish length outside off, but it straightens after pitching. Pujara looks to defend towards mid-on, expecting the ball to angle in, but it doesn't. The ball takes the outside edge. Keeper takes two steps to his right to pocket that catch. Big roar from the bowler
too short to welcome the India captain. Soars over the keeper, whose fingertips ensure that doesn't go for four byes
much fuller, on off, and he bends low to meet the ball. Driven past Jamieson
good length, outside off, but no trouble for Kohli who lets the ball go through to the keeper
good length, outside off again, but his height generates a big bounce off the deck. Left alone, and an applause from the crowd for that excellent Jamieson over
full on off, bowling from a tad closer to the stumps here. Presses forward to defend towards the off side
not short enough for the cut, and Agarwal's attempted shot is under-edged onto the deck

full, just outside off, and Agarwal takes a stride to leave the ball, but has a nervous moment thinking the ball might jag in, so he brings his back leg across to intercept the ball if needed. Wasn't needed. Through to the keeper
length ball, on off. Defended towards cover
full, just outside off. Bit of shape away. Defended firmly to the off side
full on middle forcing Agarwal to offer some shot. Straight bat, struck back to the bowler
overpitched, outside off. Kohli bends low to drive, but can't get the perfect timing. Finds mid off
back of a length, outside off, and Kohli ducks under the line of the ball
full, on off, and he punches a front-foot drive past mid on. Fielder has a bit of work to do
back of a length, just outside off, and Kohli tiptoes to defend from near his face with soft hands. Bit of 'ooh' from the slip fielders

what a dream debut so far! The debutant gets the edge, and cap no 100 at first slip makes no mistake. Fullish, outside off, inviting Kohli for the drive. He looks to hit straight past the bowler, but the ball takes the outside edge instead. Taylor tumbles backwards to take the catch, but ensures it stays safely within his hands
looks for the yorker, ends up as a low full toss on middle. Flicked off his toes to deep midwicket to get off the mark
good length, on off. Fended away to the off side
full, outside off. Rahane takes a giant stride outside off before shouldering his arms
good length, outside off. Seaming further away. Left alone
good length, angling in from outside off. Whizzes past the off stump
fullish, outside off but angling further away. Keeper takes a tumble trying to get behind the ball
full, on middle. Wobbly delivery, and he guides a flick down to fine leg for a single
full, outside off. He presses forward into a drive, but a tad off balanced. Can't beat mid off
full, on off, and he shovels a drive past the non-striker and the stumps to find the long on boundary
good length, outside off but angling in. Bit of extra bounce so he drops his gloves to this delivery. Fended to the off side
full on middle. Rahane wants to drill it through midwicket but a leading edge takes it past cover instead
back of a length, outside off. Shuffles across and then shoulders his arms
good length ball from wide of the crease. Angling into his body, and he rides the bounce to fend off the back foot
good length, on off, and fended to the leg side
fullish, outside off. No shot offered by Rahane
fullish, just outside off. Shuffles across to get to the pitch of the ball. Defended towards mid off
fullish, wide outside off. Rahane sees the ball go into Watling's gloves
good length, on off. Angling into his waist. Flicked to square leg for a quick run
full, on off. Giant stride (not needed) to meet the ball. Bat-pads a shot to mid on
back of a length. Outside off, but angling into the batsman. Aimed at his chin, and Rahane has to adjust late to defend near his chest. Hits the bottom of his handle
full, outside off, and he strokes an attempted drive from under his eyes. Finds Williamson at cover point
good length, on off, and nudged off his hips to midwicket
back of a length, outside off. Tries to scythe a cut towards point...mistimed
back of a length, just outside off. Rides it before uncomfortably fending it to the off side
full on off, and he presses forward to meet the ball right under his eyes. Driven beautifully past the non-striker for a boundary
fullish, just outside off and moving a bit away. Defended towards cover
full, just outside off. Bit of movement away again. He goes onto his back foot to fend it away towards the off side
full, on leg stump. Going further down
full, on leg stump. Flicked comfortably behind square. This was an awry line
fullish, on off. Defended straight back
back of a length, outside leg stump. Batsman takes his eyes off the ball, and ducks. Goes over his shoulder to the keeper
full, outside off. Moving further away, and he drives it through the off-side cordon. Williamson gives the ball a chase
good length on middle, and angling across. Plays at it with the bat's open face towards point
good length, on leg stump, and angling across towards middle. Fended off the back foot, and the ball flies off the blade to cover
through the covers on this occasion. Fuller from Boult, outside off, and he drives on the up through the off side
good length, on middle. Worked off his hips to backward square leg
fullish, outside off and moving away after hitting the deck. Left alone
full, on leg stump. Driven to wide mid on
just over the slips! Full, very wide, and Agarwal nearly loses his patience. No movement of the feet as he looks to drive away from his body. Takes the edge, and just beyond third slip and gully
full, outside off. Moving away. Better movement of the feet. Defended towards cover
length ball, going down the leg side
full, on off. Big stride forward to defend. Ball rolls away to mid on
good length, on middle. Looks to defend but with the bat's open face. Ball hits his blade and goes through the gap between slip and gully for a boundary
fuller, on middle. Tiny prod forward and defended towards mid off
full, on off. Uses his wrists to place his defensive shot between mid on and midwicket
back of a length, on leg stump. Extra bounce hits Rahane near his left armpit. They scamper across for legbyes
full on off, and angling away. Agarwal looks for the drive, but a thick edge lets the ball fly between gully and third slip. Agarwal livin' dangerously in the last 10 minutes
yorker length, on middle. Dug away to the leg side
back of a length, on off. He sways away from the line of the ball while dropping his knees as well
full, just outside off. Looks to defend off the front foot, but into the shot too early. Inside-edged to the leg side
good length, on middle. Angling in, and flicked to midwicket
full, on leg. Wants to flick it behind square, but it gets his pad instead. Ball rolls towards the keeper who intercepts swiftly, ensuring India don't pinch an extra run
full, outside off. Big gap between bat and body as Agarwal attempts the drive. Struck well to Williamson at cover
back of a length, outside leg stump. And it goes across to the keeper
what a ball! Full, on off, and he prods forward to drive straight. But the ball angles across, and oh-so-nearly takes the outside edge
full, on off. Better from Rahane, who walks across the stumps before fending it to mid off
good length on middle, and angling across. Left alone
good length, outside leg. Tapped to the leg side as they jog across for one
full, outside off, from around the wicket. Defended with soft hands
back of a length, outside off, and soaring over the batsman's head. Watling jumps high to stop the ball. That's Lunch
gentle length ball outside off, left alone
on a length, straight, slow off the pitch, defended to leg
on a length, just outside off, no swing away, which makes the leave slightly fraught but still too wide to make him play
fuller, looking to invite the drive. Rahane pushes this to mid-on
wide on the crease, but no swing away, which Southee wants from this angle. Defended from the crease
slight shape away with a length ball around off. Defended with an open face. Rahane wants one, but Agarwal sends him back
short of a length, into the hip, tucked away to square leg
on a length, into the pads, defended to square leg. No movement
extra bounce from just short of a length. It also holds its line outside off. Agarwal does well to stay inside the line of this one. Watling takes it head high
short of a length, angling in, Agarwal on his toes to defend this to cover
too straight this time, Agarwal gets across to glance this away for four fine of fine leg
back to the channel outside off, and Agarwal back to leaving it alone
bouncer from Southee, well outside off, Rahane stays clear of it
looks for swing, starts around leg, and the ball just keeps angling down through to Watling
slight dip and swing for Southee. Rahane ends up playing in front of the body, and gets a thick soft outside edge through point
wide on the crease, angling this in, and Rahane is right behind it in defence
slightly fuller but not quite a half-volley. Rahane gets a stride in to defend
wide teasing delivery, Rahane refuses to follow it
short of a length, good carry, but Agarwal drops his wrists and lets it sail through to Watling
wide on the crease, really full, pushed wide of mid-on where Boult puts the dive in but ends up fumbling the ball and conceding the single
wide length ball, left alone. Again, good carry for him
on a length, outside off, Rahane strides forward to defend
wide length ball, and Rahane does the usual: leave it
slightly fuller, slightly closer to off, defended off the front foot
on a length, fairly straight, defended from the crease
slightly fuller, around off, defended off the front foot this time
beautiful punchy drive but fails to beat mid-off, who is placed wide
bouncer, pretty straight, but heading down leg. Easily ducked
really full, half-volley even, pushed to mid-off
and just when you have a funky field, Southee bowls a traditional beauty. Southee goers wide on the crease, makes him play this length ball, but it leaves him after pitching, beating his bat
wide length ball, left alone
on a length, slight shape away, but Rahane is solid in defence
wide length ball, asking Rahane if he fancies a risky drive. Rahane says no, and lets it go through to the keeper
gentle short ball, Rahane has to wait for the ball to arrive. Once it does arrive, it is pulled away
proper bouncer this time, and Rahane doesn't want to risk a top edge by hooking this
short of a length, rises in towards the ribs, gets a soft edge to gully

dropped. Nearly one of those Boult specials. On a length, draws a defensive push, but the hard hands give Boult an offering low to his left in the follow-through. No other fast bowler would have got a hand to it, but Boult does. He knows he has taken such catches before which is why it is being seen as a drop
hard hands on the defensive push again. Goes to mid-off

welcome back, Mr Boult. Agarwal has sort of thrown it away after his hard work for 90 minutes in the first session. Since Kohli's wicket, though, he has been loose and has ridden his luck. Well the fountain has run out. Boult bowls a short ball, which Agarwal looks to swivel-pull, but the slow nature of the wicket and the spongy bounce means he is early into the shot. Gets a healthy top edge for a catch for Jamieson at long leg. This is a wicket Boult has conjured out of nothing
starts with a solid defensive shot
good delivery, good leave. Shapes up to swing from outside off, but goes on with the angle after pitching. Vihari is watching it closely, and leaves it be
drive away from the body but with soft hands, and he keeps it down and places it between point and cover
wide on the crease, holds its line against the angle, and it is the extra bounce that makes it look dangerous. Rahane is not playing with danger anyway. Left alone
soft hands, forward stride, placed wide of cover for a single
bouncer, not unexpectedly, but outside off, and easy to duck
another short ball outside off, Vihari drops his wrists and sways away from its line
and he nearly gets him. Bouncer, bouncer, full ball. Vihari's feet are stuck as he pushes, but he is lucky the outside edge doesn't carry to gully
full, quick, around off, hits the sticker of his bat as Vihari defends
full, shaping to swing but angling away after pitching. Rahane plays it late and defends
forward and across to cover the angle, defends with soft hands again
on a length, in the channel, Rahane plays it late and defends with soft hands again
fuller, asking Rahane to have a harder drive at it, but he refuses. Defended with soft hands again
on a length, around off, defended from the crease
this is slightly wider, and Rahane's precision tells him he doesn't need to defend this one
beaten. Short of a length, just outside off, Vihari plays the angle, but it holds the line a touch
lovely shot. Jamieson looks to check his foot movement after the short ball once again, but he ends up pitching it too far up. Vihari presents it the full face for a four straight of mid-on

stuck feet and beaten again. If anything that back foot moves further away from the line of the ball. This ball is not as full as the last so Vihari has to reach out for the drive. He fails to do so, but he is lucky it has swung too much to hit the edge
solid in defence this time

swing in this time. This is possibly the first time we have seen that from Jamieson. Actually it is seam movement, and not swing. Does too much and hits his thigh pad. For a moment that short leg fielder would have been interested in an inside edge
left alone outside off now
on a length, around off, Rahane back to defending it late
digs this in short, gets it into the ribs, but Rahane is quick in defence
wide floater to check Rahane's patience. He has loads of it by the looks of it. Left alone
another solid front-foot defensive
bouncer now, at him, and Rahane ducks it
full, around off, Rahane is solid in defence again. Boult, though, is stacking up the maidens
short of a length, around off, Vihari deep in the crease to defend it
short of a length again, a touch too straight, goes off the thigh pad for a leg-bye
short of a length, down the leg side, left alone

mean bouncer. Oh he has Rahane here, but how lucky is the batsman. A proper nut, aimed at his throat. Rahane's eyes are off the ball, and he just throws the bat up in self-defence. It kisses the top of the handle, then the arm guard, and lobs over Watling
left alone outside off
on a length, good bounce, hits the high part of the bat as Rahane defends
gentle loosener outside off, left alone
on a length, into the pads, clipped to midwicket
accurate length ball, defended off the front foot
on a length, slight nibble back in, played late, worked away for a single
right forward to defend this length ball outside off
full, floaty, swinging delivery. Patted back to the bowler
first ball after drinks! Full, on off, and Vihari tentatively presses forward to this ball angling into him. Takes the outside edge, and taken by the keeper diving to his right
back of a length, on middle, and he sways away from the ball's line
good length on middle, but some extra bounce stings Pant on his glove. Was looking to defend, but it raps him on his hand
good length on middle, and angling away. He looks to defend but the ball goes past his outside edge
good length, on leg stump. Pant takes a blow on his glove (again) after missing the defensive shot off the back foot

appeal for a catch at short leg but the umpire says not out. They don't review. This was another back of a length ball cramping Pant on a leg-stump line. Hits his body before lobbing into the air. Nicholls dived forward to take the catch under the helmet, but there was simply no bat involved
full, just outside off stump, and drifting further away. Left alone
good length, just outside off. Fended off the back foot
good length, angling in, worked off his hips to the leg side
overpitched on middle, and dug back to the bowler
full, on off, and he walks across the line before punching a drive to the long on boundary
full, on leg, and dabbed away to the gap near midwicket
back of a length on off. Soaring over the batsman's head
back of a length ball angling in. Goes for the pull, but the ball doesn't bounce as much. Mistimed to the fielder at deep backward square
good length on leg stump, angling across Pant. Fended off the back foot
full on leg, and Pant wants to whip this away over the fielder at short leg. Misses out on the swing completely. Ball hits his front leg before rolling away
short, but slower. Ball takes a tennis-ball bounce after hitting the deck. Wide given
good length outside leg, and Pant looks to work it leg-side again, but misses. Hits the top of his pads, and the lbw appeal is turned down. Too high, pitched outside leg too
full on middle. Mistimes the drive to mid off
good length, on middle. Worked off his hips to the leg side
good length on middle, and worked away to the leg side again. A tad late into the shot on this occasion
full, just outside off. Presses forward to defend with soft hands
good length, just outside off. Rahane prods forward and keeps his bat and pad close together while defending
full, on off. Strides across off stump before blocking towards the non striker
full, just outside off. Uses his wrists to nudge it towards the square-leg umpire
full, on off, and he takes a big stride before driving. Finds mid off
full, outside off, and Pant doesn't chase at it. Left alone
full, on middle and leg. Pant presses forward to defend it to cover
off the mark with a bunted drive past mid off. Full on off, and he looked for the straight boundary, but not timed as well as he would've liked
full, couple of stumps outside off, and he creams a good-looking drive to the fielder at cover
full, on off stump. Defended with soft hands to the off side
length ball on middle. Angling away. Fended with soft hands
good length, on middle. Blocked back to the bowler
full, just outside leg stump, and he flicks this behind square to jog across for one

yes-no-yes-no from the batsmen. Flicks this full ball to Blundell at square leg and Rahane takes off for the run. Pant says no, so Rahane scampers back, but then the fielder's misfield eventually allows them to take the run they wanted
full on middle. Angling across, and blocked off the front foot
full, on leg stump. Flicked off his pads to square leg
good length, outside off. Left alone
length ball near off stump. Driven to mid on
full, on off stump. Tapped with soft hands towards the non-striker
full, just outside off, and he brings the bat down in a straight line to drive past the bowler. Intercepted by mid on
back of a length, on off. He ducks under the ball's line in an instant
back of a length, outside off stump. He covers his stumps before shouldering his arms
full, just outside off stump. Left alone by Pant with the delivery going across him
full on off, slightly closer to the batsman. Pant stretches forward to defend
full, outside off stump. A bit too wide in fact. Pant offers no shot
full, on middle. Pushes forward with soft hands
good length, on middle. The attempted drive comes off the bat's top half
back of a length, outside off, and left alone by Rahane
back of a length on off. But doesn't bounce as much. Doesn't stop Rahane from pulling along the ground to the fielder in the deep though
full, outside off stump. Some extra bounce off the deck on this occasion. Well left
back of a length, on middle. Pant swivels across his crease and pulls it fine. Beats the fielder at fine-leg for a boundary
good length, on middle. Fended off the back foot
good length ball, angling across. Sticks his bat out to guide a shot towards point
full, on off stump. Presses forward to drive to mid off
full, outside off stump, and he crunches a drive to cover
back of a length, outside leg stump. Swivels early and pulls along the ground to deep backward square
full, outside off stump. A bit too far outside. No shot offered
good length, just outside off. Pant can't resist a ball in his arc. Swings leg-side, but mistimes the slog to midwicket
good length, wide outside off. Pant sees the width and tries to cut, but the ball goes under his blade
full, from around the wicket. Lands on off. Defended
full, on middle stump. Defended with soft hands
full, just outside off. Turns away but Rahane defends towards point
full, on leg stump. Defended with a big stride
full, but not as much as the previous deliveries. Rahane opts to go onto the back foot, and the attempted defense shot takes an inside edge
full, on off. Big stride, and defended
good length, on middle. Worked off his hips to the leg side
good length on middle and leg. Rahane walks across towards off stump before defending off his hips
good length, on middle. Rides the bounce and fends it towards cover
full, just outside off, and he shovels a drive to cover. They scamper for a quick single, and the throw at the keeper's end is solid. But Watling fails to connect running towards the stumps
good length, and nudged off his waist to the gap near square leg. Enough time to come back for the second
full, just outside off stump. Defended to cover
full, on off. Carefully defended off the front foot
full, but wider outside off. No turn off the deck. Left alone by Rahane
fullish, outside off. He presses towards the off side to block
good length, outside off and turning further away. Left alone
good length, outside off stump. He rocks back and fends it away to cover
full, just outside off stump. Fended with soft hands
fullish, just outside off. Wants to drive towards mid off, but flies off the bat's edge towards cover instead
good length, outside off, and he cuts it hard! But Nicholls' one-handed stop at point slows the ball down significantly
back of a length, on middle. Swivels to pull, but gloved to fine leg
full, outside off and angling further away. Left alone
full, on middle. He prods forward to defend to cover. Soft hands on display
full, just outside off stump. Defended to mid off. Tea
Patel starts with a flat delivery down the leg side
flighted on middle and leg, defended to leg
tossed up on middle and leg, angles towards off, defended back to Patel
and Pant won't allow that change of ends without some damage. Skips down the wicket and lofts this over wide mid-on for a huge six. That's modern batting for you
flat, short of a length, whipped away to the leg side for one
shortish again, defended off the back foot
starts with one down the leg side
on a length, straight, defended to leg
this one is angled across his body, and has been left alone
full, slight shape back in, Pant gets a stride in and defends
on a length, shaping up to swing, defended off the front foot
this one does swing back in a little, Pant lets it do and then clips it into the leg side
short of a length, sticks in the surface a little, dropped into the covers for a quick single
and there is some movement out of nowhere. Slightly short of a length, shapes away, kicks up a little, Pant doesn't follow it
fuller, asking Pant if he fancies a drive, but he leaves it alone
now that Boult has seen swing, he tries to go straight and then swing it from there. But ends up bowling too straight, and hits Pant's pad
slight swing again, Pant is watchful as he lets it go outside off
extra bounce this time, and slight seam back in. Hits him high on the thigh pad after beating the inside edge
wide length ball, Rahane gets a stride in and then shoulders arms

oh what doe we have here? A run-out in Test cricket. Pant has sacrificed himself for Rahane, who has pulled rank so to speak to over-rule Pant, whose call it is. Short of a length, outside off, played with an open face towards point, and this should be the non-striker's call. Rahane has charged off, but Pant doesn't want the one. Despite his no, Rahane keeps going, and then Pant has to sacrifice himself. However, it is not as straightforward a run-out. The keeper has not yet made it to the stumps so Patel at point has to make a decision whether to lob it to BJ Watling or go for the stumps. Patel gets in a soft throw in at the stumps. It is half and half, a slightly confused throw, but good enough to hit the only visibly stump direct. More than hit, he has just kissed the stump, just about flicking the bail off

oh it was good enough for Shaw, it is good enough for Ashwin. Bowling into the wind, Southee bowls the perfect outswinger, starting at middle and headed for the off stump. You need your feet to go towards the ball to cover this movement. Much like Shaw, Ashwin is rooted to the crease, and allows this to swing past the outside edge. Much like Shaw, he looks stunned
Sharma shuffles across to cover any swing outside off, but the ball heads down leg
length ball outside off, left alone
full outswinger, Sharma right behind it and defends it towards mid-off
on a length, around off, angling across, defended to cover
Boult is short here, and has been tucked away off the hip for a single
he goes for the bouncer, slightly higher than the ribs, Sharma fends at it uppishly but there is no man at leg gully. He gets off strike
gets a stride in to defend a full ball outside off
and Rahane looks for a boundary now that singles are being cut. It is not the most convincing shot as he throws his bat at this drive, but he gets enough to clear the man at point
as expected, Boult bowls a bouncer to try to keep Rahane down at this end. Rahane, though, tries the hook and gets a top edge that falls just short of Jamieson at fine leg
full, just outside off, defended towards mid-off
good bouncer, Rahane is beaten on the hook by the spongy bounce. We can see Rahane has started to get more adventurous with those two wickets
wide on the crease, bowls the inswinger from there, Rahane plays it late and helps it into the leg side for one
wide on the crease again, Sharma right across, the ball is headed straight for the stumps, and just as everybody is hoping for an lbw shout, his bat comes down in time

nearly there. Southee gets closer to the stumps, and looks for the outswinger. Sharma plays a forceful shot, which is not what he usually does. He ends up lobbing it into the leg side. It hangs for there for what seems like ages, but manages to clear midwicket
sharp bouncer to keep Rahane at the non-striker's end for the start of the next over
a lot of shuffling around this morning from Sharma. Boult stays straight with an inswinger, but ends up sliding it down the leg side
now the full straight ball looking for the lbw, but Sharma gets his bat down in time to push this for a couple through the vacant mid-on. Rahane taking all the runs on offer for the time being
this one goes straight on after pitching. Sharma shuffles across and defends
gets the shortish ball in to break the rhythm. Sharma behind it in defence
bouncer, but down the leg side, and it is easy to avoid for Sharma
and he goes for the real full one last ball of the over. Sharma is good enough to keep it out
full and outside off, left alone
bouncer, and he ducks under it

what an end to a strange morning for Rahane. He ran pant out not long ago, and is now caught at the wicket while leaving the ball. A strange strange way to get out. Southee goes wide on the crease to bowl an outswinger. Rahane knows the drill, covers the line and then looks to leave it. Except that he is not quick enough to take the bat out of the way. The ball tickles the inside edge of the bat, and Watling mops up the dying offering
full and straight, worked into the leg side for one

Southee is on absolute fire but hang on, Sharma has reviewed this decision for catch at the wicket. And Sharma is right. This is a lovely outswinger on a length outside off, Sharma is looking to drive, and there is a noise as the ball passes the bat. Aleem Dar thinks about it, and then raises his finger. Sharma wastes no time in reviewing, and the replays show it has missed the bat and just flicked the back pad on the way as he is squared up
wide on the crease, full, swinging away from middle, Sharma good enough to defend it back to him
short of a length, rising towards his ribs, fends it down
wide on the crease goes Boult, bowls full and straight, Shami drives, but straight to mid-off
bouncer, down the leg side, beats Shami's hook
driven on the up, crisply too, but straight to mid-off again
goes for the real full one, maybe a yorker even, and ends up bowling a full toss. Worked into the leg side
on a length, angling across him, Sharma defends after shuffling across
wide on the crease again, Shami has a big mow at this full ball, hits it straight to mid-on
again wide on the crease, full wide outsiwnger, Shami is drawn to it, and he gets a thick enough edge to clear gully

dropped by Williamson. Can you believe it? Southee is wide on the crease again, Shami has a mow again, gets a huge top edge and the ball goes miles up in the air and swirls when coming down. Williamson from mid-off has a lot of time to get under it, gets both hands to it, but it bursts through his fingers
another shout for catch as Sharma hits in the air into the leg side, but this doesn't carry to mid-on
just to rub salt into the wounds, Shami flick-drives this full ball straight between the bowler and mid-on for a four all long the ground
uppish again. Pushes at a wide length ball with had hands but it doesn't carry to the man at cover
short of a length, outside off, defended with a slightly open face
short of a length again, seams away a touch, beats the edge as Sharma follows it
slightly shorter, gets it higher than the previous two, but not high enough to discomfort the batsman
dug in again, Sharma is pushed deep into the crease and defends
yes it is the full one, Sharma is caught on the crease, and is beaten by the slight away movement
wide length ball, and left alone
wide on the crease, wide outside off, and for a change Shami shows restraint and leaves this alone
bouncer from closer to the wicket. This is headed for the badge, Shami has his eye off and swings at it. Hits the bat and goes straight down
wide on the crease again, on a length, driven on the up to short cover
tries the short ball but without much swing. Rib high only, and Shami pulls this away dismissively to square leg for four
Shami is teasing New Zealand here. Big old swing at a wide outswinger. Ends up slicing it into the cover. Blundell runs back and gets a dive in, but can't even get a touch on the ball

and Shami survives again. What a charmed innings again. Length ball, angling in, skied towards mid-on. Boult is running in from the two-thirds mid-on he is at but can't get there. A regulation mid-on gobbles this one up
short of a length, rising towards the chest, Shami manages to keep this down
on a length outside off, nicely dropped wide of cover for one

and Jamieson has four. He is the only one who can get five in this innings now. Dug in short, outside off, Sharma has another fend at it. Just a bit of movement away, good enough to take the outside edge
wide length ball, left alone
fuller, closer to off, beats him on the outside edge
full outside off again. Bumrah looks to defend, but the ball whizzes past his outside edge
that's all over for India as Shami goes for a wild heave. Length ball, outside off, and he slashes this attempted cut in the air. Blundell gets under it near point and that's India 165 all out
good length, on off, and jagging away from the left hander. He shoulders his arms
good length, on off, and angling away. He covers his stumps before shouldering his arms
back of a length on middle, and the angle takes it away from Latham. Left alone again
first runs! Fullish, on leg, and flicked past the short-leg fielder. They call early for the third as the fielder at fine leg takes an extra moment to get around the ball
full, outside off stump. Blundell gets across, but offers no shot
tidy first over for both sides. This was a good-length ball outside off, but not in the direction of the stumps. Blundell shoulders his arms
around the wicket to Latham. Full outside off, and jags away after hitting the deck. Left alone
full, lands outside off but angling into the stumps. Defended off the front foot
full outside off, but moves away after hitting the deck. Latham goes for an expansive drive but the ball goes just past his outside edge
full, outside off and moving away. Left alone
full outside off. Moving away after hitting the pitch once again. Latham offers no shot
full, just outside off and angling in on this occasion. He presses forward to defend, but the ball whizzes just past his outside edge. Terrific over from Ishant
good length, outside off, and he sticks his bat out to guide a shot towards point
good length, wider outside off. Blundell shoulders his arms
fuller, outside off and angling inwards. Blundell puts his front foot across off stump before shouldering his arms
full, on off. Looks to defend but it flies off the bat's inside half to the leg side
full, but too wide outside off. Pant runs across to his right to intercept
full, on middle. Looks to nudge it leg-side but it hits his pad instead. Ball rolls away towards cover
full, just outside off but angling in. He prods forward to defend
full, just outside off. Looks to defend, but it takes the outside edge instead. Falls short of third slip
full outside off stump. Jags away this time. Left alone
runs after quite a while. Full on off, and tapped with soft hands into the gap near midwicket
over the wicket to Blundell. Full, just outside off, and he covers his stumps before shouldering his arms
full, just outside off, and angling into the stumps. He presses forward to firmly defend
around the wicket to Latham. Good length outside off, but zipping straight through to the keeper
full, on off, and flicked off his pads to the gap behind square on the leg side. Fine leg runs around to intercept
good length, on the fourth-stump line. Ball goes straight through to Pant
good length on off, cramping Latham this time. Uncomfortably flicked off his hips to the leg side
full, on off stump. Minimal footwork as he bunts it back towards the non-striker
full on off, and he inside-edges this flick behind square on the leg side. Enough time to jog back for the second run
good length from over the wicket. Lands on off, and gets a bit of extra bounce. Tiptoes to defend towards the leg side
fullish on off. Looks to work it to the leg side off the back foot, but ends up edging it onto his pads
full, on off stump. Blundell is forced to play at this. Defended, towards the leg side
fullish, just outside off stump. Ball holds it's line, and Blundell shoulders his arms
back of a length, jagging into his pads. Tries to clip it leg side but the ball hits him above his pads instead
full, just outside off stump. Left alone by Blundell
full, just outside off stump. Lathan presses forward to defend comfortably
full, angling into him, and clipped through the gap near midwicket. Confident shot as they run three

appeal for lbw but not given. Full, just outside off, but angling into off stump. Blundell misses the defense, and it hits his front leg. Kohli reviews. Looked like there were two noises there, and the replay confirms it. Bat-pad saves Blundell and India lose a review
off the mark but tapping this length ball to the off side for a rapid single
good length, on off, and Latham presses forward to defend
good length, just outside off. Latham shoulders his arms as soon as he gauges the ball's line
full, on off stump. He prods forward to defend firmly
edged over the cordon! Good length outside off. Blundell swivels to flick over square leg, but leading edge takes it over the slips instead
length ball, on off. Fended
good length, just outside off. Moves across before guiding a flick off his hips to deep midwicket
around the wicket to Latham. Back of a length outside off and angling into the stumps, but the ball goes over them
full, but wide outside off stump. Left alone. Lunch
really full, dug out to midwicket
already an effort to bowl full this session. This is a half-volley with no swing, and Blundell drives it wide of mid-off. Kohli won't be happy with the lack of drive from Ashwin there

beauty. That is the lrngth. Slightly shorter than 5 metre, Blundell can't reach with the half-forward movement, and it jags back in after pitching, beating the inside edge and bouncing over the stumps
on a length, swinging in, bunted into the leg side for a single
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
fuller, just outside off, holds its line, and left alone
length ball, straight, seams back in, hits the thigh pad
stays in the channel just outside off, left alone
short of a length this time, and Blundell is right behind it in defence
slightly fuller, but Blundell stays back and defends outside off
drops this in slightly shorter, and for a batsman who likes to hang back like Blundell does, this becomes a long hop. Early into the pull and hits in the air over square midwicket
short of a length, outside off, defended from the crease
full, no movement away, and defended with a half-forward movement

and India have some luck here. Latham gets out in the most excruciating fashion for a batsman. Nothing delivery down the leg side, angling further away, Latham is strangled and he gloves it on its way. Shoulder of the bat actually, and then the glove. The seam on the ball suggests the ball should move away, but it kept going with the angle
oh hello, what a welcome. This one kicks from short of a length, and hits the thumb of Williamson as he looks to fend. It lobs safely. It has hit the middle finger and the thumb on the right hand
pitched right up, Williamson pushes it to mid-off, and feels the finger immediately. You would hope it is not worse than just a bruise
on a length, angling in, defended to leg, still feeling the right hand
full, just outside off, defended solidly. Williamson calls for more attention on his hand during the over break
the spongy bounce again. Blundell looking to repeat the pull from the last over, but this one stops on him and possibly seams away a touch too. The leading edge falls safely short of mid-off, though
bunts this length ball into the leg side for a single
wide length ball, left alone by Williamson
short of a length, straight, defended back towards him
slightly short of a length, Williamson looks to punch it away, but gets an inside edge onto his boot
on a length, outside off, left alone again. And on every New Zealand leave, there are oohs and aahs from behind. I assume it is Kohli, full of energy
short of a length, wide, Blundell resists going for the cut
on a length, just outside off, shaping in, defended from the crease
on a length outside off, left alone
slightly short of a length, defended off the back foot
slight swing back in, but doesn't bring Blundell forward. Defended to leg
lovely delivery. Full, swinging in, but holding its line after pitching. Blundell watchful enough to not close the face early
short of a length, wide, he goes back to punch it through the vacant point region to get off the mark
slightly fuller, and Williamson avoids indulging with it
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
short of a length again, Williamson likes this length, and he defends well
slightly fuller but Williamson still stays back and defends
full, really full, a yorker, dug out without incident followed by a loud NO call
on a length, gets this to move away, left alone
short of a length, into the hip, doesn't beat square leg as he tucks it away
short of a length, defended off the back foot. Slightly late into the shot
fullish, on off, holds its line, defended back to him
long half-volley, no swing, not timed as well as he would have liked, but beats the man at cover to get three runs
full down the leg side, and a cheeky shout of 'catch it' from Kohli as it goes past harmlessly
on a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
moves slightly forward to defend this length ball angling in
short of a length, slow off the surface so Blundell shelves the pull and defends it back to him
fuller, but a touch too wide to make him play
draws him forward with a length ball but Blundell is solid in defence
slightly shorter of that good length, and Blundell goes back to defend
short, not too wide, but short enough. Most batsmen would stay low and cut this up and over, but Williamson gets airborne to keep it down and still beats point
on his crease to defend this length ball
on a length but too wide to make him play
short of a length outside off, pushed to the man at point with an open face
short of a length, wide, if Williamson has batted for an hour or so, he will be punching these through square cover. Right now, though, he leaves it alone
fuller, angling in, defended to mid-on
short of a,length, tucked away off the hip for one
on a length, outside off, defended from the crease
lovely-looking shot as Williamson now feels confident with a push-drive on the up, but he can't beat the diving man at point
stays fuller of good length, draws him forward, but Williamson is solid in defence
on a length, holds its line a touch, hits the outside half of the bat and rolls to gully
on a length, slightly wide, and is left alone
wide length ball, easy leave for Blundell
short of a length, wide, punched away between point and cover for a couple
short of a length again, Blundell stays back to defend
tries the bouncer but Blundell loves anything short. Pulls this dismissively in front of square and hits it straight into the ground
wide length ball, left alone again
short of a length, tucked away off the hip. Slightly uppish but there is no fielder in the fine square-leg region
uppishly tucked away again but there is no fielder at square leg
full teasing delivery but too wide to make Williamson have a drive at it
oh the good-ole Williamson punch. Short of a length, sits up outside off, and he rocks back to drive it off the back foot. In front of point and square of cover
fuller, straighter, drawing a respectful defensive shot from Williamson
nearly a yorker, dug out back to Bumrah
lovely shot. Too full from Bumrah, and all Williamson has to do is push-drive this wide of Ashwin. No great flourish, no great power. Just the timing allowed by the fullness of the ball
out of nowhere Shami bowls a beauty. This is on a length, just outside off, Blundell has to defend the line, but it seams away a touch to beat the outside edge
stays on a length, Blundell is on the crease to defend this
short of a length again, and worked into the leg side for one. Not enough good deliveries being strung together by Shami
short of a length, wide, slightly spongy bounce means he can't time it perfectly, but still gets a single wide of cover
on a length, straight, defended to mid-on
slightly fuller than good length, draws him forward, holds the line, gets the outside edge, but he has played it with soft hands to make it die in front the slips
good length on off. Fair amount of turn first ball. Worked to short leg
short outside off. Turning into KW. Punched to long on
tossed up, just outside off. Dug away to wide mid-on, who runs to his right to slide and stop the ball
half-tracker, outside off. Williamson backs away and guides a cut in front of square. Pujara hunts it down after a long chase, saving the fourth run
good length on off. Drifting in. Quicker too. Tapped off the back foot to the on-side
fullish, just outside off. Worked with the turn to square leg off the backfoot
deft touch from KW. Good length outside off, and Williamson opens his bat's face to run it down to third man, finding the tiny gap on offer behind on the off side
good length, just outside off and angling into the stumps. Firmly defended off the back foot
fuller, just outside off. Blundell presses forward to defend
good length, from wide of the crease, angling into Blundell. Defended off the back foot
fullish on off, and he prods forward to defend
good length, on off and nudged to midwicket. A bit of yes-no between the two fielders. Time for drinks
fullish, outside off and turning in. Fended off the back foot
good length, outside off. Sharper turn. KW makes room before guiding a cut to point
length ball, outside off, slower through the air. Worked off his hips to square leg
full outside off. Quicker from Ashwin. Defended
full, just outside off, and he presses forward to defend
bit of air in this delivery. Full outside off, and he presses forward to bat-pad it
full on his pads, and flicked to the gap near square leg. Scampers back for a second
glorious! Full, just outside off, and he brings the bat down to drive past the bowler's left for four
short ball on off, and he ducks under the ball swiftly
good length, just outside off stump. Defended
full, outside off. He covers his off stump before shouldering his arms
good length, outside off, and straight through to Pant with KW offering no shot
full, on off stump. Defended with a big stride
ball! Drifts this in, lands full outside off, and Blundell looks to defend. But the ball turns sharply, goes between bat and pad, and the keeper can't grab it either
full, on off. Defended, and the ball flies to the leg side
good length, on middle. Uncomfortably defended to the leg side
tossed up, outside off.. a tad too wide. Defended with a giant stride
full, just outside off. Worked from off stump to square leg
full on leg, and guided to fine leg. Good use of the wrists
full, outside off, but angling into off stump. Defended after walking down the ground
good length, outside off stump. Left alone by Blundell
got him! Full, just outside off, and Blundell prods forward to defend, but the ball goes through him, and pegged off stump back. A bit of swing into the batsman too!
fullish, outside off. Defended off the bat's middle to mid-off
full, on leg stump. Flicked off his heel to fine leg to get off the mark
full, outside off. No real turn, and the attempted drive takes the outside edge to third man
full on off stump. Defended off the front foot with soft hands
full, on off stump. Defended again, with the turn
full, on off stump. Fended with the turn, off the front foot
good length, on off stump. Bowls this from wide of the crease. Flicked off his hips to square leg
good length on off. Pushing the batsman onto the back foot. Punched to long on
good length on off. Defended with soft hands. Rising delivery
full on off, swinging slightly into KW. Defended back
good length, outside off stump. But going straight into the gloves of wicketkeeper Pant
full, on off stump. Presses forward to defend
full, on leg stump, but angling further down. Pant scurries to his left to intercept
full, outside off, and left alone. Through to the keeper
full, outside off, and drilled back to Ashwin
fullish, outside off. Turning in. Mistimes a drive
full, just outside off. Quicker and flatter. Defended
He's putting on a show! Full, outside off, and he goes down on one knee before shovelling a slogged six over deep midwicket
appeal for lbw turned down as Ashwin's offbreak beats Taylor's defense. Might have turned too much
good length, outside off. Taylor backs away and punches to cover
good length outside off, and angling into Taylor. Looks to defend, but gloves it onto his body
streaky! Short, outside off. Wants to cut it over the slip cordon, but hits the back of his bat to fly towards fine leg instead
full on middle, and swinging into his pads. Flicked behind to a squarer fine leg
full, just outside off stump. Through the drive early, hits the top-half of his bat and rolls away to mid off
full, on middle, and worked with the bat's closed face to the leg side
full, just outside off stump. Defended with the turn to the leg side
full, outside off. Turning in and hits his front leg as he tries to defend. Loud lbw appeal, but impact was perhaps outside off
good length, outside off. Sharp turn, and KW makes room before cutting through point. Enough time to jog back for the third
good length, outside off, and shovelled from outside the stumps to square leg
full, on off, and pushed past the non-striker to long on
full, on off stump. Defended with a big stride
good length, outside off, but doesn't get the ball to angle in. Left alone
good length, outside off, and he sticks his bat out to cut towards point
back of a length outside off, and a bit of wobble in the air after hitting the deck. Williamson's tempted to defend off the back foot, but pulls the bat back ta the last moment
good length, outside off stump. Left alone
overpitched outside off stump. Left alone
fullish, on off stump. Blocked firmly towards the off side
full on middle, and dug down to long on
good length outside off stump. Makes room to cut. Finds point
good length outside off. Turning into KW. Worked off his hips to the leg side
full on leg stump. Flicked to square leg for a single
drift in the air. Full outside off, and turning in. Defended
full, just outside off stump. Defended with soft hands
fullish, outside off stump. Big stride across before defending
good length, outside off, and he cuts behind square. Nobody there in the deep. Team hundred too
fullish, just outside off. Defended with the bat's open face. Guided towards the cordon
full, outside off and angling into the stumps. Drilled back to the bowler
good length, angling in from outside off. Tapped towards midwicket
good length, just outside off, and his back-foot punch finds the gap between point and cover. A couple more for Williamson, only six away from his fifty now
good length on off. Played off the backfoot to mid on
full, on middle. Defended with soft hands
full on off, and quicker from Ash. Defended
good length, on off. Looks to defend but takes an edge to the off side instead
good length on off. Bends forward to defend towards the leg side
yorker length, on leg stump. Dug away to midwicket
good length ball, angling into him. Flicked to square leg
good length on off stump. Angling in, and defended off the back foot to the leg side
full, just outside off stump. Defended with soft hands in the direction of the bowler
yorker length, just outside off. And Williamson toe-ends a drive to the left of mid off
good length, on off. Goes onto the backfoot to defend
back of a length on off, testing Taylor with a short ball. Too short, and he ducks
full, on off. Looks to sweep, but doesn't commit fully to the shot
worked away to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
full, on middle, but turning down further. Padded towards backward short leg
full, on off stump. Defends
full on off. Turning into Taylor, and defended to the leg side
good length on middle. Sharp turn that Taylor can't connect with. Hits his thigh and goes past backward short leg
full ball, just outside off stump. Taylor stretches forward to block
full on off stump. Angling in, and Taylor firmly defends off the front foot
full outside off, and Taylor takes one and a half steps forward to defend towards mid off
length ball, just outside off. Pushed off the front foot to cover
short ball, lands outside off but angles over Taylor's shoulders. Pant scurries to intercept
that's all over the place! Short ball again, Taylor ducks again, but unlike the previous ball, Pant can't grab it. Too high for the keeper
what a way for NZ to finish the session! Full outside off, and he presses forward by crunching a drive through the covers. Tea break
full outside off, and defended with soft hands first ball
flighted outside off, and pushed to long off
full, on off. Turning in, and defended with soft hands to the leg side
full and fast on middle. Tapped to the leg side
full on middle, and he paddle-sweeps with the turn. No backward short leg after tea and Taylor capitalises
full outside off. Defended back to the bowler
full outside off, and he cuts from close to the ground. Finds Agarwal at gully
length ball outside off that goes through to Pant with the batsman offering no shot
full, on off stump. Defended with soft hands, with the gloves close to his pads
good length outside off, and he rides the bounce to try and punch through the off side. Mistimed
good length on off, and angling in. Williamson walks across towards off stump to try and maximise the gaps on the leg side, but eventually simply defends
good length, on off. Guided with soft hands to gully
length ball on off, turning in. Defended to the leg side
pushed to long on
what a way to get to fifty! Flighted outside off, and Williamson walks down the pitch before flicking this in the air, beyond midwicket, and the ball rolls away for a boundary
good length, on off. Defended off the back foot
good length, on off. Makes room and pushes towards point
length ball outside off. Turning in. Taylor looks to defend, but it hits the bat's handle before flying away past short leg
thumped! Full, a tad too wide, and Williamson caresses a drive through the gap between cover and mid off
full, on off stump this time. Driven again, but this time to mid off
full on off, and he defends with the straight bat
length ball on off stump. Defended off the back foot with the bat's open face
shortens his length further, forcing Williamson to stay on the back foot. Fended
good length on off. Fended off the back foot
full on middle, and clipped behind square for a single
flighted on off. Worked away to the leg side
good length outside off. Sharp turn into Williamson, who has to hop away to make further room. Cut square
good length outside off, but too outside off. Makes room again, and cuts it in front of square for four
good length, outside off. Cut behind square to the sweeper-fielder in the deep
length ball, on off stump. Defended with soft hands
full on off, and he drives straight past the non-striker. Finds mid on though
good length on off, and worked off his hips to cow corner
deft! Full on middle, but angling down leg, and he guides it to fine leg for four more
full, just outside off stump. Blocked towards cover
good length, outside off. Shapes to cut but can't connect
full outside off, and he looks to drive through the covers. Mistimed
length ball, outside off. Tapped off the back foot to mid off
good length ball, angling in, and flicked to square leg
defended to short midwicket
good length, on middle. Flicked off his hips behind square
good length, outside off. Left alone
good length, outside off. Defended off the back foot
in the slot and put away. Full, outside off, and thumped through the covers
yorker length, on middle. Dug back
good length, on off. Defended with soft hands
short on middle, and he ducks under the delivery's line swiftly
full outside off, and Taylor goes for the drive again. This time the ball zips through, and goes between his bat and body
full on middle, and driven towards mid on
wide length ball, left alone
nice cover-drive but Pujara makes a diving save to his left to short cover
on a length, shaping in towards off, defended off the back foot
beautiful. Languid drive on the up to a wide length ball. This time the face opens a little bit more to beat that man at short cover
half-volley, driven crisply again, but this time Pujara's dive at short cover saves four runs
bouncer, starts outside off and then moves in the air passing the ducking Williamson
good start. Length ball, just outside off, seams away a touch, bounces extra, hits Taylor high on the bat
inswinger, starts too straight, and it is picked away to fine leg for one
slightly short of a length, outside off, Williamson thinks of the punch but pulls out at the last moment
on a length, outside off, defended solidly from the crease
good ball. The awayswinger. On a length slightly fuller than good length, around middle and off. It looks like you can work it to leg, but then the ball moves away. Williamson does well to adjust
short of a length, Williamson thinks of the punch again, but decides it is too close to his body to free his arms
appeal for lbw as this length ball seams back in past the inside edge of Taylor, but this has hit the thigh pad so it is clearly sailing over. The umpire agrees
slight seam again, this team the other way, hitting the outside half of his bat as he defends
looks for the punch as Bumrah pitches this short of a length. The ball seams back a touch to cramp him, but he goes ahead with the shot. His inside edge goes past Pant for four
yorker, outside off, dug out behind point
lovely delivery, holds its line outside off, beating the outside edge as Taylor defends
length ball outside off, Taylor defends off the front foot
length ball, angling in, defended to leg
short and wide, Williamson goes back and doesn't bother with keeping it down. Clears the man at point with ease
extra bounce as Williamson looks to get behind this short-of-a-length delivery. Drops his bottom hand - sort of - to try to keep it down, and succeeds at it
slightly short of a length, and Williamson is so precis that he doesn't punch this. Had it been a foot shorter he might have gone after it
fuller this time, swinging in, pushed wide of mid-in for a single
full, straight, some shape away from him. Taylor presents the solid full face in defence
full on off, and defended
thumped to cover
full on middle, and driven with the bat's closed face to mid on
good length ball on his hips, and guided behind square for two more. NZ now lead
full, just outside off. Driven uppishly, and falls just short of Bumrah on his followthrough
good length, outside off. Tapped towards cover
stinker! Good length ball, takes a bit of extra bounce, hits his glove, and lobs into the air. Short leg gets an easy catch. They're checking for the no ball, but Ishant is marginally fine
good length ball on middle. Angling across the left-hander. Past his outside edge
full on middle. Sticks his bat out, and gets an edge to gully. Along the ground though
good length, on middle. Tapped to midwicket off the back foot
full outside off. Seaming away, and left alone
around the wicket, full outside off and shaping away. Left alone
length ball, on off, and flicked to midwicket
good length, outside off. Punched to cover
good length, on middle. Nudged off his pads to leg side
good length again. Turned off his hips
good length outside off from around the wicket. Punched off the back foot to the bowler
good length, on off stump. Punched again
good length, outside off, and he bends his knees to cut to deep point
full outside off, and his attempt at getting Nicholls to drive fails. Left alone
full, on off, and the on-drive is mistimed past Williamson. Lobbed in the air in fact. Gets off the mark
full, on off. Defended off the front foot
good length, outside off. Sticks his bat out and nudges it towards point
full outside off stump. Left alone
good length, on middle. Flicked off his pads to the leg side
good length, outside off from around the wicket. Left alone
full, on off. Defended off the front foot
full, on off stump. Big stride forward to defend
full on off. Defended towards the leg side
good length, outside off. Left alone
good length on off, and turned around his hips to backward square
full outside off, and firmly driven to mid off
Full on middle stump, and he presses forward to defend
full on middle. Blocked again off the front foot
Length ball, quite wide outside off. Williamson tries to pad it away but misses
full and wide, driven square
good length on middle, angling into the batsman. Flicked to the leg side
full on middle, and defended
full on off and defended with the turn
Full on leg stump, and nudged to midwicket
good length on middle, and flicked behind square. Dangerous run attempted
good length outside off. Left alone
full outside off and driven to cover
length ball on middle, and nudged to midwicket
good length ball, angling down, and helps it on its way to fine leg
back of a length. He rides the bounce to defend
tossed up on off, defended back to him
flatter, slightly shorter, and he goes back to defend
nice dip on this, Nicholls has to stretch far out to defend
slightly quicker, slightly flatter, and he goes back to defend
goes back to a length ball, punches it wide of cover for a single
full, just outside off, defended to leg
on a length, angling in from round the wicket, defended from the crease
full, outside off, left alone for Pant to dive and collect as this moves back in after passing the stumps
short of a length, slight shape away, left alone
wide length ball, left alone. Might go after these once he feels comfortable at the wicket
short of a length, wide, seaming away, and he has left it alone again
fuller, closer to the stumps, makes him play, and Nicholls pushes it solidly to mid-off
wide on the crease, gets turn and bounce, but Williamson plays with soft hands and doesn't jab at it. It goes down
full, no turn this time, which means it hits the outside half of Williamson's bat
flatter, the ball lands on the leather and doesn't turn, but soft hands again mean the edge falls short of slip
allowed to go back and push this wide of mid-off for a single
goes back to defend a length ball back to Ashwin
goes back and defends another offbreak to leg
length ball, angling in, defended to leg
short of a length, wide, and steered wide of gully for a couple. Shami has struggled with his accuracy today
short ball, pulled away in the air. Not entirely in control but there is nobody manning the square-leg region

the spongy bounce again. Williamson falls short of yet another hundred. Looks to drive at a wide length ball, but it comes off slow from the surface, and he ends up chipping it to cover where substitute Jadeja takes a catch diving forward. He walks off to a generous applause from the crowd
bouncer first up for Watling, and he ducks underneath it
another bouncer, and this one doesn't get up. Watling, though, still manages to duck it
full, dipping, middle and off, defended to mid-on
goes back as he sees flatter trajectory. He is hit on the pad as the ball angles down leg
this flighted delivery runs off the inside half of the bat for a single into the leg side
flat quick delivery, defended from the back foot
tossed up outside off, slight drift, blocked off the front foot
drift, dip, then turn, hits the inside half of the bat and goes wide of short leg for one
short of a length, outside off, goes deep into the crease, opens the face as he defends
on a length, around off, defended off the back foot
full outside off, pushed to cover
bouncer, just outside off, and he ducks it
wide on the crease, angling it in, and Watling is right behind it
full, around the sixth-stump line, left alone after getting a stride in
full, just outside leg, and he paddles it around the corner
too full outside off, pushed away for an easy single into the covers
on a length, just outside leg, Nicholls has to defend it off the front foot
too full, and swept to long leg for one
stays back to defend a length ball
full, outside off, defended off the front foot
length ball around off, Nicholls stays back and defends
fuller this time and angling in on middle, Nicholls doesn't over-hit it, just times it through wide long-on
Shami corrects himself, a length ball around off, Nicholls gets behind it and blocks
length, around fifth stump. Nicholls covers his stumps and lets it go through to Pant
fuller but further away from the batsman, left alone again
short of length around off, stays on the back foot and taps it down
length ball around off, lunges forward and blocks
length ball around off and middle and spinning in, defended towards short leg
tossed up outside off this time, defended on the front foot
too full and on the stumps, Watling flicks it with the wrists between mid-on and short midwicket, gets a couple
playing with soft hands. For a moment it looked like he was beaten in the flight, turns it away towards short leg
flighted outside off, Watling is watchful here, pushes it on the off side
fuller on the stumps, just punched past straight down the ground. Mid-on could only accompany it to the boundary
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards the left of mid-on
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg
length ball around fifth stump and angling in, shouldered arms
a touch fuller around off, comes forward and defends it under his eyes
length in the corridor, and left alone. Doesn't rise much and Pant collects it at shin height
short of length outside off, backs away and cuts it past point. But the ball just stops inside the boundary line. Three they get
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards backward square leg
86kph, length ball around middle, comes forward and works it towards fine leg
length ball, tossed up around off, looks to defend but the ball takes the inner half and bounces towards short leg

Ashwin gets the left-hander. A low catch to his right by Kohli at second slip/gully. Was a length ball around middle and leg, didn't turn much maybe just straightened but Nicholls stretched his front foot straight down instead of towards the ball and as a result, got squared up. A thick outside edge that was dying on its way but Kohli got his hands under it. Suddenly, it looks much better for India
tossed up around off, comes forward and blocks
short of length outside off, stays back and defends it on the off side

length ball at the stumps, Watling was looking to work it on the leg side but it stuck a bit in the surface. Means Watling was a touch early into the shot. The ball just drops in front of him after hitting the bat
length ball on middle, moves across and tucks it towards square leg
fuller but down the leg side, too far away for a flick
length ball on the pads, flicked towards fine leg this time
short and wide, de Grandhomme stands tall, gets over the bounce and cuts it in front of the cover fielder, off the mark with a boundary
length ball in the channel, Watling looks to defend but gets a thick outside edge that bounces through between second slip and gully

and Bumrah has his first wicket in some 48 international overs. Dream start for India. Bounce for Bumrah. Rises chest high from short of a length, just outside off. He doesn't need to play at it, but he does, and ends up shouldering it through to Pant
and he drives on the up first up. Not a firm drive, but a push. Can't beat mid-on
short of a length, slight movement in, defended
on a length, just outside off, slightly low bounce, defended from the crease
short of a length, wide, Southee looks for a punch. Beaten
full, into the pads, clipped away, a diving midwicket keeps them down to one
slight shape back in from a length, defended from the crease
fuller than good length, just outside off, defended back to him
slightly too straight, worked around the corner
full delivery, holds its line, de Grandhomme pushes at it, is hit on the outside half of the bat
full and straight, de Grandhomme is thinking runs here, but he finds short midwicket again
short of a length, wide, punched away beautifully, leaning back as he does so. Between point and cover it goes
shortish again, has the width, but the slowness of the surface means Southee doesn't force the issue here
Bumrah continues to be short of a length. This time Southee drives it on the up, wide of mid-off, gets a single
on a length, outside off, de Grandhomme waits for it to arrive and then dabs on top of it for a single to third man
finally he bowls full this over, the ball seams in after pitching and goes between the inside edge and the off stump
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
wide length ball, left alone
this is only slightly short of a length, and de Grandhmme rocks back to cut it to square third man for one

oh what a gift for India. This is a hit-me ball on the pads. Except it is even worse than that. This is actually too far down leg. Southee does well to get his bat to it, but he has hit it in the air straight down fine leg's throat. That is the only man stationed in acres ans acres of wide open green spaces. What a Sunday morning for India. All the scrap yesterday means such slices of luck count for something. More than something. Game on at Basin Reserve
bouncer outside off, left alone
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of mid-off to get off the mark in Test cricket
full and wide, de Grandhomme resists the temptation to drive
length ball, angling in, pushed through the vacant mid-on region for one
good delivery. Not full enough to drive, not short enough to sit back. Draws a forward-defensive
full, angling in, pushed towards the short midwicket

Bumrah has another. You can't keep such bowlers out for too long. de Grandhomme has reviewed the lbw decision. Seam movement from a length, from just outside off, de Grandhomme caught on the walk, and is beaten on the inside edge. I think it is doing too much, and ball-tracking confirms that. Aleem Dar has to change his decision as this is missing leg
full, outside off, slight seam movement again, pushed to mid-off
slightly short of a length, outside off, defended to cover. Jamieson is on strike for the next over
on a length, just outside off, solid front-foot defensive from Jamieson
full, straight, runs off the inside side half of Jamieson's bat for a single past short midwicket
