Sharma tries that filth-down-the-leg-side trick again. de Grandhomme has a go at it and misses. India have reviewed this for a catch down the leg side. They might walk into a casino too at the end of this all. They haven't quite hit the jackpot here, though. The woody noise they hear is the bat hitting the ground as the ball passes the bat. No reviews left for India
and out of nowhere, considerable seam movement. On a length, outside off, he plays the angle, but the ball goes away like a legcutter to beat him
and finally de Grandhomme frees up his arms. Just about full enough for him to have a swing at it, and he crashes it over mid-off for four
full, on the pads again, a fair dinkum wicket-taking delivery this New Zealand innings, but de Grandhomme flicks this safely above midwicket for two
short of a length, around off, defended with an open face
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot

dismissive. Jamieson showing why he used to be a top-order batsman as a youngster. Shami tries the bouncer, gets it only chest high, and he has dismissed it out of his presence with a disdainful pull in front of square
on a length, on off, Jamieson gets a forward stride in, clearing the front leg out of the way, and defends it solidly back to the bowler
yorker, good thinking. The bat has to come down from a mountain. He does well to keep it out, though
good delivery, on a length, holding its line in front of off, and draws a forward-defensive from Jamieson, who is equal to the task
on a length, outside off, he covers the line and then withdraws his bat
bouncer, middle and leg, de Grandhomme ducks it
good bouncer, cramping him up, de Grandhomme has a bit of a hook, but the mis-hit doesn't carry as far as fine leg
on a length, wicket to wicket, defended solidly to leg
full, straight, hits the inside half of the bat and goes to mid-on
tries the bouncer again, but it rises only rib high for Jamieson, who pulls it square of fine leg for four more. He might be the most organised 6'8' batsman you will ever see
short of a length, wide, there is a deep point in place to keep them down to one
wide on the crease, on a length, driven on the up, uppishly, but wide enough for cover. Gets a single as the diving Shaw gets a hand to it
short of a length, wide, steered square on the off side for another single
on a length, starts around off and moves back in, bunted into the leg side for another single. This one feels like it is a middle over in an ODI
short of a length, holds its line, defended back to him. Some extra bounce on this one
short of a length, wide, punched away for a single
gentle length ball into the pads, clipped away wide of mid-on easy as Sunday morning. Despite the slow outfield, it goes all the way for four
on a length, outside off, defended from the crease
long half-volley. de Grandhomme stands tall and punch-drives this straight of the diving mid-on for four more
bouncer, loopy bouncer, and easy to duck under
short of a length, outside off, good bounce, and left alone
on a length, around off, defended from the crease

nearly a return catch. Boult would have taken this. Short of a length, Jamieson looks to defend, but the extra bounce means it lobs back down the pitch. It is an arm's length from Shami, and it has stayed in the air for forever. Half a dive, and he gets it. But he just stretches his arm out, and only gets fingertips on it
seam back in, hits the inside half of the bat and runs away for a single
fullish, outside off, defended off the front foot
on a length, slight shape away outside off, defended respectfully
full, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
on a length, into the pads, easy single to keep the strike
on a length, some extra bounce, defended watchfully
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, deep point keeps them down to one
streaky. Looks to loft this straight, but the ball holds its line, running off the thick outside edge for a single to third man
bouncer, down the leg side, ducked
another bouncer, ducked again. This is a wide
short of a length, angling in, defended back to him
on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
full, just outside off, and he drills a drive to mid off. Ashwin slow to run to his right, allowing Jamieson to complete the single without much worry
good length, outside off. Tiny step forward before defending from under his eyeline
good length ball, angling in. Looks to defend, but the ball takes an inside edge and rolls away to backward square
back of a length, on middle. Jamieson pulls, but gets the top edge and the ball goes over the keeper's head. Goes all the way in fact!
good length, outside off stump. Stands tall and punches it back towards Shami
good length, outside off. Firmly defended towards cover with the angled bat
good length, on middle. Turning into his pads, and flicked off the back foot
full, outside off. Leans forward to defend
good length outside off. Big stride square before defending
tosses this, full on leg. Goes for a slog behind square, but bat-padded towards square leg
faster ball. Length outside off. Punched back to the bowler
tossed up again, full on middle and angling into his pads. Goes for the wild heave, but hits his pad before rolling past Pant's left
good length, just outside off. Defended, but the ball takes the outside edge and rolls away to point
good length, outside off. Punched off the back foot towards cover
good length, on middle. Flicked off his hips to midwicket
exquisite! Full, outside off, and he meets the ball so beautifully for a front-foot drive. Work for mid-off, who has to give the ball a mighty chase. Fifty partnership too
full, outside off. De Grandhomme defends, and hits the ball back past Shami
full, just outside off stump. Defended with soft hands
length ball on leg stump. Turning further down leg as the batsman misses his flick
into the stands! Full, outside off, and he drags this from across the line, swinging square and smashing this over deep midwicket
good length, on middle. Guided off the back foot to midwicket
into the stands again! Tossed up outside off, and he takes a big stride before slogging wth the turn. Catch dropped in the stands
full outside off, drifting away. Past Jamieson's outside edge to the keeper
full, on off stump. The attempted defense is played towards cover
good length, just outside off stump. Defended with soft hands
good length, on off. Defended back firmly
falls just short of Kohli! Full outside off, and it brings CdG to drive. Takes the outside edge, and falls short of first slip diving to his left
good length, outside off stump. Left alone
good length outside off, and he gets behind the line of the ball to defend
full on off, and angling into his pads. Defended to Shaw at short midwicket
full on middle, and turning into leg. Flicked behind square to the fielder in the deep
full on off stump. Defended straight, and Ashwin cuts across to intercept
good length on off. Angling across, and punched back to the bowler
good length on leg stump. Flicked to deep midwicket
leading edge just over midwicket. Tries to flick this length ball behind square, but the bat's face turns too early. Lucky that didn't go straight to Kohli there
good length on middle. Punched to mid on
full, outside off, and he drives firmly to mid off
full, on off, and the on-drive goes past Ishant on the leg side. But he runs towards the boundary to stop it from wriggling away for four
good length, outside off, and he punches with the bat's open face. Ball flies away to deep point
yorker length on off, but Jamieson's up to the challenge. Brings the bat down... just in time
good length on middle, and guided with the bat's closed face to midwicket
fullish, outside off. Resists the temptatiion for a drive. Checks a shot towards cover
full, on middle. Drifting in from outside leg stump. Driven to long on
holes out! Full on middle, and Jamieson goes for the big one once again. Toe-ends the shot on this occasion, and Vihari, at long on, runs to his right to complete the catch.
full on off, and skidding through. Defended off the back foot to the leg side
full, on off, and angling across again. Big stride to meet the ball in a defensive manner
good length, on off. Punched to short midwicket, where Kohli is lurking
tossed up, on off and angling across. Defended with soft hands
around the wicket to the new batsman. Fullish outside off, and Patel brings his bat down to defend. Inside-edge takes it past the stumps and to the fine-leg boundary. Team 300
good length on off. Tries to defend but edged towards the slip cordon
yorker length attempted but ends up as a low full toss. Bunted back after getting his toes out of the ball's way
back of a length, outside off. Patel ducks under this
back of a length on middle, and Patel ducks under it once again
full outside off, but too close to his body for the cut. The shot is under-edged onto the deck, over the stumps, and through to the keeper
good length on middle. Flicked to deep backward square, where they manage to pick two runs from
good length, on leg, and he flicks over fine leg, but Bumrah is quite inside the boundary line and so the ball goes over his head
full on middle, and he dances down the wicket for a leg-side swipe. Inside-edged past the keeper's left to fine leg for another double
good length, on middle. Punched off the back foot to long on. Gives Patel two balls off Ashwin
full, outside off and skidding through from around the wicket. Left alone
tossed up on middle. Bit of turn away from the left-hander, but defended with soft hands
full ball on middle, and going down the leg side. CdG misses the flick, and the ball hits the side of his pads before going to the keeper. For Pant's part, he dived forward to catch this dying ball
good length, just outside off but angling into the stumps. Defended
good length outside off stump. Shoulders his arms
good length outside off and he stands tall to defend off the back foot
full, on middle, and tapped with soft hands towards short midwicket
full on off, and driven to mid off for a single. He'll keep the strike for the next over because Bumrah was a bit late to react to that shot
full, outside off and he toe-ends a shot back to the bowler

good length, on leg stump and turning further down. De Grandhomme tries to flick, but it gets a touch off his glove and Pant takes a catch down the leg side. Loud appeal and umpire Kettleborough was late in raising his finger, but eventually does, perhaps because the batsman was walking off already. An excellent innings from de Grandhomme
full, on off, and he walks down the pitch before tapping a single towards cover point
full and wide from around the wicket. Left alone
full, just outside off. Big stride to defend
full on off, and skidding into his pads. Defended onto his pads
tennis smash over mid off! Good length outside off, and he smacks this horizontally from near his eyeline over Bumrah inside the circle
good length, just outside off. Tries to play that shot again, but the ball goes over his blade
full, outside off, and Boult backs away trying to hammer a drive through the covers. But makes no contact on this instance
good length on middle, and cramping Boult for space as he was backing away in the first place. Defended back to the bowler
change of pace, full outside off, and he swings across the line. Finds enough connection to club the shot over mid off, and the fielder needs to give it a chase
yorker length, outside leg stump though. Flicked behind square for a single
full, on off, and he comes down the wicket before hammering a slog between deep midwicket and long on!
full on leg stump, and he defends inside-out towards wide mid off
full on middle, and sliding into leg stump. Defended off the front foot
full outside off, and turning away. Follows the ball with his bat, and defends towards first slip
full, outside off stump. Defended off the front foot towards short cover
tossed up on leg stump. Defended towards the on-side
good length on middle, and angling down leg. But Boult's backed away tremendously to get leg-side of the ball. Goes for a wild slog but makes no connection
good length, just outside off. Opens the bat's face and runs it down to third man for a couple. Smart choice of shot!

dropped! Good length on middle, and Boult hammers this flat-batted shot straight to Ishant, but the ball bursts out of his hands and rolls into the long-off boundary. Difficult chance, mind you, that was hit with a lot of sting
back of a length, outside leg. Boult pulls unconvincingly, and the edge takes it just fine of the fielder at fine leg. Off the top edge, and very nearly went for six
good length, on off. Boult exposes leg stump walking across before flicking off his hips to midwicket
good length on off, and he defends it from near his chest towards point
full on off. He skips down the wicket before defending it back
good length, outside off, and this turns the wrong way after pitching. Boult wants to drive, but goes past his outside edge
full on off, and firmly defended back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, but Boult skips down and smashes this - despite a toe-ended shot - over long on! Good use of the feet once again to generate some extra momentum
full, on middle. Defended with the bat's open face towards cover point. Says 'no, no, no' for the single
good length on off, and some extra bounce from that attempted carrom ball. Gently tapped to the off side and off they go for a single
yorker length, but becomes a low full toss before Boult backs away. Brings his bat down in time, even managing to clobber it into the gap near cover
good length on middle. Bunted down the ground to long on
good length, outside off. Defended towards cover
full, outside off and a full-blooded drive finds the fielder at mid off
back of a length, on off. Patel swivels to swing but the ball goes past his bat
back of a length on off, and Patel ducks under this delivery to see the 100th over out
back of a length outside leg stump from around the wicket. Pulled along the ground to Bumrah at deep midwicket, who does well to stop the four. The ball was travelling

that's his five-wicket haul! Back of a length on middle, and Boult looks to tap this behind square instead of ducking under it. Gloved, and lobs in the air, where Pant makes no mistake. Ishant takes five while New Zealand finish with a lead of 183. That should be lunch as well

and lack of foot movement nearly does him in again. Swing from middle and off, much like his first-innings dismissal, but this time it is shorter, and hits him high on the back pad after beating the outside edge
squared up again, the swinging delivery hits the outside half of the bat
fuller but still not as full as the first-innings dismissal. Shaw squared up a touch again, but defends well
on a length, swings a touch from middle, and Shaw plays a more convincing defensive stroke
wide on the crease, no swing this time, worked away with the angle for single wide of mid-on
lovely shot. Half-volley from Southee as he looks for swing. Agarwal leans into it, has his front leg clear, allowing him to place it through the covers for four
some swing back in, but ends up too straight and is clipped away past square leg
on a length outside off, defended
on a length, swinging a touch back to Agarwal, defended from the crease
this one angles across, and Agarwal is watchful and leaves it alone
this one swings back in, on a length, allowing him time to defend off the back foot
on a length, straight, defended off the back foot
looks for swing but starts too straight and heads down the leg side
beauty. That is the ball that will continue to trouble Shaw. Outswinger, dipping on him, leaving him and beating his half-forward movement. Slightly fuller, and it might have taken the edge
down the leg side, looking to start swinging it from too straight
oh the other one. Southee pitches it up again, just outside off, Shaw's big back lift comes down to play for an outswinger, but this goes straight on to take his inside edge
length ball into the pads, worked away for an easy single
uppish. Shaw continues to play his shots without looking comfortable. He sees this angled into his pads, and goes for a big drive. The leading edge falls wide enough of mid-on
slight swing, but too straight and too short, tucked away off the hip
clever bowling. Seam pointing towards slip, and it goes on with the angle even as Shaw is expecting it to swing back in. Beats the edge and falls short of Watling who completes an awkward take
short of a length, angling across him, defended
slight shape back in from just outside off. Shaw covers the movement and defends to leg
wide on the crease, starts too straight, and is clipped away for a single
slightly fuller of good length, defended from the crease as it threatens to swing back in
the real full outswinger. Just a touch too full, and Shaw can defend it despite no foot movement
wide on the crease, on a length, slight swing, Shaw moves his front foot and defends solidly
slight swing again, slightly squared up again as he defends
on a length, no swing, defended to mid-on
full, looking for swing, but there isn't much. Driven to mid-off this time
now gets the outwinger straight, Shaw drives on the up and uppishly, but it falls well short of mid-on
short of a length, a little bit of movement back in, defended off the back foot
looks for swing but overpitches it. Agarwal lets it swing, and then plauys the punchy off drive. Mid-off is too wide to even think about fielding this
on a length, outside off, left alone
bouncer, reminding him of the first-innings dismissal. Agarwal wants to have nothing to do with this one
nice shot. On a length, outside off, his front foot takes him towards the ball, and then he pushes it wide of mid-off
full, too wide, to make him play
bouncer, middle and leg, and he ducks under it
lovely shot. This is not even that short, but short batsmen can manufacture back-foot shots. Rocks back to the length ball, and punches it through cover for four
wide on the crease, angling in, cramps him up on the punch
defended off the back foot
overpitched, but cramps him with the straight line. Hit straight to mid-on
the inswinger. That big Shaw back lift makes him a candidate for the quick inswinger too. This time, though, the bat comes down just in time to get a thick inside edge onto the pad
Agarwal gets into an awkward position on the short ball again. He is looking to avoid it, but sees this one has followed him so he plays the pull and manages to keep it down
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
nicely played. Short of a length, wide, he steers it away between the slips and gully. Keeps it down too

and the plan has worked. This is excellent planning and execution. Boult digs one in from round the wicket, Shaw is surprised by it and fends at it. There is a short backward square leg in position just for this. Latham takes a diving catch to his left
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
full, outside off, left alone

what a beauty. How unfortunate not to get a wicket with that. Lovely dipping outswinger, just outside off. He has to play at it. But the ball hits the surface, takes a bit of grass off it, and seams away to go with the swing. Beaten
this one is angled in, defended to leg
looks for swing but ends up too straight and too full. Clipped away past square leg for three runs
leading edge. Pujara sees this swinging in, looks to turn the face, but the ball stops at him and pops into the off side. Falls straight of short cover
this time short midwicket is in action. This one has seamed in from just outside off, takes the thick inside edge but falls short of that man
lovely outswinger, Pujara does well to play with soft hands and straight bat. Gets a soft outside edge for a single
full, outside off, left alone
length ball, angling in, but not enough to make him play
fuller, checking Pujara's patience, which he has in loads. Left alone

nearly another wicket. Mean bounce from round the wicket. It also follows him. Pujara fends at it, and gloves it behind square on the leg side. That short backward square leg is interested but it clears him
bouncer, proper bouncer, and Agarwal ducks it
length ball, middle and leg, defended from the crease
full outside off, defended off the front foot. No movement on this one
bouncer, Pujara ducks underneath it
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot
this one starts on middle and keeps sliding down. Worked away for one into the leg side
streaky again. Plays a full straight ball around his front pad. The bat comes down in time to prevent the lbw, but he has hit this in air. Only that it is just wide of short midwicket
wide on the crease, wide outside off, left alone
on a length, angling in to off, defended to cover. Wants a quick single but is sent back. The two have a word after that
the bouncer that doesn't quite get up. Agarwal does well to get his shoulder underneath it as he ducks
short of a length, angling in, defended off the back foot
bowls the bouncer, asks him if he wants to repeat the first-innings shot. Agarwal says no thanks
squared up as he defends a length ball outside off. Manages to keep it down
angles in a bouncer, which Agarwal ducks efficiently under
gentle outswinger to begin with, left alone
short of a length, wide, and Pujara doesn't go after this one. If he bats an hour or so, he will start doing that
another gentle outswinger, and left alone outside off
Pujara early into this defensive, gets an inside edge onto the pad
full, driving length, but Pujara is hit on the inside half of the bat. The slowness of de Grandhomme hampering the timing here
nice little outswinger, around off, Pujara plays a solid front-foot defensive
short of a length, outside off, he leaves it alone
inside edge as he is in his toes to fend this shortish delivery. His pads save him
bouncer, but too wide to bother Agarwal
fuller, just outside off, Agarwal moves forward and defends
length ball sliding down leg. Left alone
accurate bouncer, and Agarwal is ducking all of them after his first-innings dismissal
de Grandhomme is straight and accurate with nibble each way. This one nudges back in, and Pujara plays it late to keep it out
this one swings away. Pujara plays late again, and defends it with a dead bat
slight extra bounce as Pujara moves into a forward-defensive. Hit on the sticker
fuller, allows Pujara a drive, but it is not a hard drive. Fielded by de Grandhomme himself
driven again, to the middle of the three short covers, but along the ground
Pujara has a nibble at this. Length ball, swinging away. If this is bowled at 140ks, Pujara leaves it alone, but the ball stays in his eyeline for so long his hands follow it. Lucky not to edge it
length ball, on off, defended solidly to cover
short of a length, angling in, defended to mid-on
first runs in five overs, an uppish off-drive off the outer half of the bat, wide enough of the diving Jamieson
on a length, shaping in, played with soft hands for a single into the covers
bouncer to Pujara, who ducks under it

big shout for a catch at the wicket, not given, and reviewed by New Zealand. This is a ripsnorter of a bouncer, seaming back in and following him as he tries to get his gloves out of the way. The ball hits the arm guard for sure, but the question is, did it kiss the glove on the way too? HotSpot shows no mark on the glove, but it is not that conclusive. After many more replays, using Zoomer on it, there is no conclusive evidence that it hits the glove. It can't be ruled out either because there is a slight movement of the glove. However, it is fair enough to stay with the on-field decision. Great processes, great reasoning, and you live with that uncertainty and move on. Well done, all
short of a length, wide, rare loose ball from de Grandhomme. Agarwal steers it away to the vacant point region. That will release some pressure
full, slight swing away, defended to mid-off
down the leg side, Agarwal looks for a glance, but misses
on a length, just outside off, defended solidly
slight swing away, defended off the front foot
New Zealand try the India trick for a catch down the leg side but this has gone off the thigh pad
back of a length outside off. Pujara drops his hands, letting the ball go through
back of a length on off, aimed at Pujara's neck. He rides the bounce before blocking
back of a length, outside off, and through to the keeper as Pujara sways away from the ball's line right at the last moment
back of a length, on off, and soaring over his head. Too short in fact
good length, outside off, and tapped to the off side. Pujara wants the single, but Mayank sends him back! Good call
full outside off, and defended towards cover
back of a length, on middle, and he sways and ducks to let the ball go through
full, just outside off, and he presses forward to defend
good length, on off. He shuffles across before blocking off the back foot
length ball, angling down leg, and tucked to square leg for a scampered single
good length on middle, and worked off his hips to the leg side
full, on off stump. Presses forward to defend
full on middle, and nudged off his pads to midwicket
good length ball on off, but it takes off after hitting the deck. Agarwal was looking to defend on the front foot, but it generates something extra and hits his back elbow
good length outside off. Bit of seam movement away from him. Left alone
full, on middle, and he checks a drive to de Grandhomme at short mid on
good length outside off, and through to the keeper. Left alone
full on middle. And flicked off his toes. Finds square leg though
back of a length on middle, and he ducks under this delivery
fullish, outside off and seaming away. Left alone
full on middle, and angling into his pads. Tries to flick, and inside-edged to square leg
good length, outside off, and he clatters a pull in front of square. Doesn't go all the way though....
full on off and he takes a tiny step forward to defend. Flies off the bat's inside half to the leg side
good length, on the fourth-stump line outside off. He covers his stumps and shoulders his arms

around the wicket, good length on middle and angling across the right-hander. He mistimes a pull, finding the gap on the leg side, forcing the fielder to run towards deep midwicket to stop the boundary
fullish outside off stump. He lets the ball go through to the wicketkeeper
full, on off, and he defends under his eyeline off the front foot
back of a length on leg stump. He takes his eyes off the ball and ducks
good length, on leg stump. Drops his gloves and plays it gently off his hips for a single on the leg side
good length, on leg stump. Tapped off his hips to square leg again
full, outside off stump, and he taps a drive to short cover
good length on off, and he gets behind the ball to defend
full, just outside off stump. Seaming away slightly. He misses
good length, on off. Defended off the back foot to the leg side
good length on middle, and flicked off his hips
full, outside off and seaming away. He covers his stumps before shouldering his arms
back of a length on leg stump, from around the wicket. He ducks under this comfortably
good length outside leg stump but cramping him near his elbow. Tapped with the bat's closed face to the leg side
good length on leg stump. He tiptoes expecting extra bounce but it doesn't go that high. Defended from near his waist
good length on middle, and he tiptoes again to cover for the extra bounce. But there's none of that, and defended from near his hips
back of a length on off, and this one has taken off. Pujara ducks
good length, outside off stump. Covers the stumps and then shoulders his arms
full, wide outside off and moving further away. He throws his bat at this, slicing it conveniently over gully for four
full, just outside off. Mayank reaches out, meeting the ball under his eyeline. Struck back to the bowler
good length on off, and tapped off the front foot to cover
good length outside off, and seaming away. He covers his stumps and shoulders his arms
good length just outside off. He gets behind the line of the ball, and fends it away towards cover
full, just outside off, and he meets the ball on the front foot for a firm defense
full outside off, and angling into the right hander. Defended by closing the bat's face
back of a length, outside off but angling in. Worked off his chest-area to the leg side
full, on middle and leg. His head falls over while trying to defend, but soft hands ensure it stays along the ground
back of a length outside off, aiming for Pujara's throat region. He ducks under it
comes over the wicket now. Length ball on middle and leg to start off. Tucked off his hips to square leg
back of a length on leg stump. Doesn't bounce as much, and gloved onto the floor
full, on leg stump. Clipped to short leg, but on the bounce
tossed up, on off. He sticks his bat out to push a shot towards backward point, where Boult dives to intercept
good length on middle, and he rocks back into his crease to hammer a pulled shot along the ground to deep midwicket
length ball, outside off. Defended to backward point
full, just outside off, and he takes a big leap to the pitch of the ball before hammering it over the bowler's head for a six!
length ball on off, and the ball sneaks into him. Defended off the back foot
good length on leg stump, and worked off his pads to the leg side. Can't beat de Grandhomme at midwicket
back of a length outside off, from around the wicket. Angling into the batsman's body, but he ducks under it
good length, lands on off, and angling down leg stump. Pujara looks to nudge it fine, but gloves it instead
good length on middle, and worked away to square leg. Let the ball come onto him this time
length ball outside off, but deviates in sharply with the angle! Through Pujara, but the impact on the back leg is a tad high
back of a length on middle, but going over his shoulders. Pujara ducks and the keeper scampers across to his left to stop the ball
good length on middle, and turning across. Looks to defend, but some extra bounce hits him near his chest
paddled! Full, on leg, and he plays a sweep shot very very fine! Reaches his fifty with that shot
good length, outside off. Makes room and punches to cover
good length, on off, and he goes back inside his crease to defend towards cover
full, on off, and he takes a giant stride to defend
fullish, on middle. Skidding through, and defended with soft hands
back of a length on off, from around the wicket. Rides the bounce to defend off the back foot
back of a length on middle, and he ducks swiftly under the ball's line
full, outside off, and he shovels a drive through the covers! Loud applause as Pujara runs two
full, on off, and tapped towards mid-off. Williamson runs to his right to intercept
good length on middle and leg. He gets behind the line of the ball and offers the bat's full face to defend
good length ball from around the wicket. Pujara shoulders his arms
full on middle, and tapped off the front foot to mid on
full, on leg stump. He comes down the wicket to play an aggressive shot but adjusts late to defend instead
full on middle, and turning across. He looks to defend for the straight ball, but the turn takes his outside edge
full on off, and he comes down the wicket to defend it back to the bowler
full, on leg stump, and flicked off his toes behind square. Chase for the fielder at deep backward square, where de Grandhomme stops the ball from going for four
good length outside off. Turning a bit away and punched towards cover point
full on off from around the wicket. Bit of movement in the air, coming into the batsman. Defended towards short mid on
full, just outside off stump. Defended carefully towards cover
fullish, just outside off, and he presses forward to defend
back of a length on off, and he ducks under the ball's line. Through to the keeper
full on middle, and he presses forward to defend towards mid on

what have you done, Pujara! Full outside off, seaming in sharply, and Pujara looks to shoulder his arms off the session's last ball. But the ball has come in, and gone past his pads before knocking off stump back. Boult is ecstatic!
good length, on leg stump. Clipped to square leg
full, on off, and the ball holds up instead of going straight through. Defended, but high off the bat
through the gap! Plays this drive uppishly, and there was a man at cover, but this was wide enough for Kohli to still be in the middle. Southee puts his hands on his head
full on middle, and Kohli shuffles across before flicking to deep backward square
full outside off, maybe hoping Kohli tries to drive again. Left alone on this occasion
too full, too wide, and he shoulders his arms
good length, wide outside off, and Agarwal wants to cut square. Misses it altogether
good length, outside off, and tapped off the back foot to point. Big shout of 'no' from Kohli

good length, outside off, and he sticks his bat outside his body. Takes the edge, and falls just short of Nicholls at gully. He parries the ball towards the slip cordon to ensure India don't take the single
back of a length, outside off stump. He ducks under the ball's line
good length, outside off, and seaming further away. Left alone
good length outside of, and he sticks his bat out to check a punched-shot towards cover
full, outside off, and he presses forward to confidently defend
overpitched, outside off stump, and he covers his stumps with his stride before shouldering his arms
full, just outside off, and Kohli steps across to work it towards mid-on, but the ball takes an edge and goes between the giant gap between gully and wideish first slip
full, on leg stump, and clipped off his pads behind square
back of a length on middle, and he swivels to pull at fine leg
good length, on middle, and nudged to midwicket
good length, outside off stump. He covers his stumps before shouldering his arms
back of a length, on off, and he ducks under the ball's line
full outside off, and he pushes away from his body to wide mid off
good length outside off. He shuffles across the stumps and leaves it alone
full, outside off stump, and he presses forward to drive. In the air and falls just short of wide mid off
full, on off, and he leans into a checked shot towards mid on
back of a length, and he ducks under this bouncer
good length on middle. Goes deep in his crease before blocking
good length, on leg stump, cramping him for space. Tries to flick, but gloved behind on the leg side. Falls short of the keeper's grasp
back of a length, outside leg stump. Batsman takes his eyes off the ball, but ducks along with it too
good length on middle, and he pulls this confidently, over midwicket, and into the boundary on the leg side
back of a length, but lands outside leg stump. Mayank gets his bat out of the ball's way
full, outside off, and going straight through to the keeper
overpitched outside off, and Kohli shuffles across before shouldering his arms
good length outside off, and seaming further away. Left alone
full, just outside off, and he presses forward to check a drive to mid off
good length, outside off stump. Seaming in slightly, but Kohli's happy to let it go
fullish, outside off stump. Tempting Kohli to drive but he doesn't give in. Shoulders his arms
good length on leg stump, and he shuffles to get behind the ball's line before defending
good length, on leg stump, and he can't connect with the attempted pull. Through to Latham
back of a length, on leg stump, trying to cramp Agarwal. He ducks

taken down the leg side! Overpitched, outside leg stump, but Agarwal has tried to flick behind square. It touches something, and the keeper collects. Umpire gives it out and Agarwal is walking back. But Kohli asks him to reconsider, and he goes for the review with just one second left on the clock. What's interesting is the bat doesn't seem to make contact with the ball on the hotspot, so now they're checking for the snicko, and there it shows that there's a very tiny edge off the bat. Agarwal has to walk back, Aleem Dar has given a terrific decision this evening. India lose a review
back of a length, on middle and getting big on Rahane. Defends from near his face, and the ball nearly rolls onto his stumps
back of a length, on leg stump, and through to the keeper because Rahane ducks on this occasion
back of a length, outside off stump. Left alone
full, just outside off, and Kohli uses his wrist to open the bat's face before driving through the covers
full, just outside off stump. And defended towards cover
full, on middle, and flicked to square leg for a single
good length, outside off and angling away. Sliced towards point
back of a length, on leg stump. Swiftly ducks under it
good length, on off, and defended off the back foot
good length on off, and he rides the bounce to defend from near his chest
back of a length, on leg stump, cramping Kohli. Tries to nudge it leg side, safely, to short fine leg
back of a length, on leg stump, and Kohli ducks after taking his eyes off the ball
full, but wide outside leg stump. Too wide. Surprised the umpire didn't give that as extras. Kohli, for his part, offered no shot
back of a length on leg stump, and angling into middle. He rides the bounce and defends with soft hands
good length on leg, and a bit of extra spongy bounce off the deck. Rahane thinks about tapping this leg side from near his chest, but the ball hits his body instead
good length, from around the wicket, but outside leg stump. Left alone
back of a length on off, and angling further away. Rahane offers no shot
good length on middle, and he swivels to pull. The ball whizzes past his outside edge
slapped over point! Back of a length, outside off and angling away, allowing Rahane to free his arms
back of a length, on middle, and he plays the horizontal bat to guide a shot towards midwicket
back of a length, on leg stump, left alone
full, on off, and he clips this to midwicket
full outside off, and moving further away. Left alone
full, on middle, and the attempted flick is inside-edged onto his pad. Ball rolls away and they take a quick single
full, just outside off, and he presses forward to defend
full, just outside off. And he defends with the bat very close to the pad
good length, on middle, and tapped off the back foot to the leg side
good length outside leg, and angling into middle. Tapped with soft hands to cover for a quick single
back of a length, outside off stump, and he sways past the ball's line
good length, outside off, and he sticks his bat out to tap a shot to cover for a quick single
good length on leg stump, and going over the batsman's shoulder
full, on off stump. And tapped with soft hands to cover. Straight to the fielder though
back of a length, outside leg stump and he shoulders his arms to let the ball go through
full, just outside off, and through to the keeper after hitting the batsman's pad. Impact was outside off stump
full, on middle, and defended to mid on
full on off, and defended to mid-on once again
full, outside off and swinging slightly away. He goes down on one knee and hammers a drive through the covers, making full use of an ordinary delivery
full, on off, and defended towards mid-on
full, on middle, and defended towards the leg side
full, just outside off, and bowled from around the wicket. Drives it well, along the ground, but goes straight to the fielder at cover

he's nicked it! Boult goes short, Kohli looks to take him on by pulling, but he's hurried by the faster delivery, and misses the shot. Takes a bit of the bat and BJ makes no mistake. Failed in both innings (for his standards)

full, outside off but seaming in sharply. Vihari offers no shot, looking to shoulder his arms, and the ball whizzes past the outside of off stump. Umpire Kettleborough has one hand covering his mouth, because even he knows how close it was
defended off the front foot
back of a length, on off, and he ducks under this ball
full, on off, and tapped to midwicket for a quick single

yorker length, on leg stump. And he fails to dig it out. Ball hits his boot, and the lbw appeal is turned down, maybe because the umpire thinks it's going down leg. Will NZ review? Yes they are! But it's a waste: ball's going down leg. Both reviews are now exhausted for New Zealand
good length, outside off stump. Left alone
full, on off, and defended back to CdG
full outside off, and swinging away. Driven firly, but intercepted at cover
full, just outside off stump. Left alone by Vihari
full, on leg stump, and flicked off his pads to deep backward square
good length, on leg stump. Tries to nudge it fine, but can't get bat on ball. Hits his thigh guard
back of a length, from around the wicket, from outside off. Vihari ducks again
back of a length on middle, from over the wicket. Ducks again
full, on off, and swinging into his pads. Jams his bat against his pads, and bat-pads a defensive shot to the leg side
length, from around the wicket, on off stump. Worked to the leg side
back of a length, this time on middle stump. Ducks under it again
good length, on off, and defended
full on off stump. Defended off the front foot to mid on
good length, on middle, and going down leg. Can't get bat on ball. Through to the keeper
appeal for lbw, but not given. Too high
full, outside off, and worked to the gap behind point for a couple
full, on off stump. Defended back to the bowler
full, on off, and he crunches a drive straight. Mid-off runs to his right, dives, and stops the ball from going for four
full, on off. Aiming at his pads, hoping the ball shapes into him. Driven back to Boult
good length on off, and shaping slightly away. He sticks his bat out to fish for this delivery. He's lucky the ball doesn't taken an edge to the keeper
good length, on off, and pulled along the ground to midwicket
good length, on off, and he punches off the back foot
good length, on leg stump. And he guides it fine to fine leg
full, just outside off, and through to the keeper with the batsman offering no shot
full, just outside off, and defended towards cover
full, on off. He looks to defend, but an inside edge takes it down to fine leg
good length, on off, and tapped off the back foot to mid on
full, just outside off. The ball stays low en route to the keeper
good length, on middle, and tapped off his hips to square leg
back of a length, on off, and through to the keeper
full, from around the wicket, on off stump. Big stride forward to defend
good length, on off, and angling in. With short leg lurking, Vihari carefully works it behind square
good length, just outside off, and blocked by riding the bounce
full, just outside off, and driven to mid off. Finds the fielder however
back of a length, outside off from over the wicket. Vihari taps it from near his chest to cover for a quick single
good length, outside off, and seaming further away. Left alone
good length, on off. Closer to the stumps. Defended off the back foot
full, on off, and he defends by getting behind the line of the ball
full, on off stump, and he drives straight back to the bowler
back of a length, on off, the ball goes through to the keeper
full, outside off, and seaming away. Left alone
good length, outside off stump. And left alone
fuller, just outside off, and moving away. Wants to defend, but the seam movement takes it past his outside edge
good length, outside off, and tapped to cover with soft hands for a quick single
full, just outside off stump. Defended
full, on off, and defended towards mid on
full, outside off. And he presses forward to place a drive to cover. Cut by mid-off running diagonally to his left
good length, outside off, and left alone
fullish, just outside off, and tapped away to the off side
full, on middle. Defended with soft hands to mid on
full, just outside off stump. Shoulders his arms on this occasion
good length, on off. Defends by getting behind the line of the ball
good length, just outside off. Taps it towards short point looking for the run, but Rahane says 'no'
full, on off, and he gets behind the line of the ball to defend
back of a length on off, and he misses the pull. Ball hits his helmet.... so we need a moment here. Physio checking up
good length, just outside off, and he covers his stumps before shouldering his arms
full, just outside off, and defended towards mid off
back of a length, on leg stump. He swivels and views the ball going into the keeper's gloves
full, just outside off stump. And he shoulders his arms
good length, outside off, and left alone
good length, outside off, and he covers his stumps before shouldering his arms
good length, just outside off. Blocked off the back foot towards point
full, just outside off, and he looks to drive, but plays inside the ball's line instead. Just past the outside edge, just past off stump. Peach of a delivery
good length, outsie off, and through to the keeper
back of a length, on off, and he gets under the line of the ball by ducking
full, outside off, and through to the keeper
good length, outside off and angling in. Defended
full, on off, and defended with soft hands
good length, on off, and he pulls one-bounced to deep midwicket
good length, outside off, and heading further away. Left alone
full outside off stump. Seaming away and left alone
good length, outside off stump. He opens the bat's face and slashes hard at this over the infield
good length, outside off, and cut square. Finds the gap again! Back to back fours
full, just outside off stump. Tapped to the off side
full, on leg stump, and he places an on drive to the fielder positioned
full, outside off, and he sticks his pad forward to meet the ball. defended
full, outside off stump. Left alone
bowlin'! Full, just outside off, and Vihari expects it to angle in so looks to drive. But played down the wrong line again as the ball jags away and goes past his outside edge
good length, outside off, and he shoulders his arms
good length, on middle. He rocks back to block
full, just outside off stump. Presses forward to defend
full, outside off, and he crunches it to cover. Vihari gets caught behind the bowler, so needs to run around him. May have been run out if there was a direct hit
back of a length, outside off, and goes over his shoulder to the keeper
back of a length, outside off stump, but not quick enough. Sees it go through to the keeper
full, on off, and firmly struck back to the bowler. Well stopped by Jamieson on the followthrough
back of a length, on off, and he sways to get out of the ball's line
good length, on off, and defended off the back foot
full, just outside off, and tapped with the bat's open face to point
back of a length, outside off. Rahane looks to slap it over the slip cordon but can't make the connection
good length, on off, and punched to mid off
full, just outside off, and he taps this defensive shot to cover
good length ball on middle. Rising delivery, and Vihari fends with soft hands, allowing the ball to drop near his legs
full, on leg stump. Defending to mid on
full, on middle and leg. Driven to mid on
good length, on off. He shuffles across and defends
back of a length, outside off, left alone
good length, just outside off. And defended
back of a length, on middle, and goes over the bowler's head
back of a length, on leg stump. Fended off the back foot
good length, outside leg, and left alone
good length, outside leg stump. Tapped to the leg side
good length, outside off and angling in. Tapped to point for a single
good length, on off. And he blocks off the back foot
full outside off, and he drives away from his body. Work for third man
back of a length, on leg stump. Nudged to the leg side
good length, on off. And blocked off the back foot
full, on off, and tapped towards cover
back of a length outside leg stump, from around the wicket. He swivels and shoulders his arms
back of a length, outside leg stump again. Vihari gets out of the line, and the ball goes over middle stump

good length ball on leg, takes some extra bounce. Vihari tries to get out of the ball's way, gloves it behind square. Falls just short of leg gully hovering. But it would've been not out even if it was a catch since the hand wasn't on the handle/bat
back of a length, on middle, and through to the keeper
yorker length, but wide outside leg stump. Left alone
good length, on off, and angling across. He slaps a punch through the packed infield to finish India's day at 144/4
good short ball, angling across him, Rahane does well to keep his wrists down
on a length, straight, Rahane turns this to leg
slight shape back in, looking for that lbw ball, Rahane is equal to it
slightly fuller, no swing, nicely punched away to mid-off
uppish. Rahane throws his bat at the ball Boult tries to take across him. He gets a thick edge but it flies wide of the gully
lovely bouncer, middle and leg, Rahane tries the hook, but is lucky not to edge it. No way he can control this one
on a length, outside off, defended from the crease
fuller, just outside off, slight shape, left alone
stays full but angles this down the leg side
wide on the crease, trying to tempt Vihari into playing at a ball that is not close enough to him. Vihari resists
wide on the crease, this time he angles it in, and Vihari is equal to it
full, dipping, just outside off, pushed to short cover
Boult is looking for that lbw ball as Rahane's front foot keeps going across. He plays around the front leg, but does so late and with soft hands

oh the biggie. Boult does it. This is a really good ball. Angled in, on a length, just outside off, you have got to play at it. The ball, though, seams away a touch. Only enough to take the edge and not actually miss it
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
full, looking for swing, Pant reaches the ball with a forward movement and defends

huge shout for lbw, not given, but New Zealand don't have reviews left. Pant is looking for that swing, but this one nips back in off the seam and hits him in the front. My initial reaction is, it has done too much and is probably missing leg or clipping it. Don't think a review would have helped. Technology backs me up: clipping top of leg
right behind this one to end a successful over for New Zealand
swing. Just outside off. Full. But Vihari not going after it

this one draws him in. The hallmark of swing bowling: it lands shorter than you expect it to. Vihari thinks he has got the half-volley, but he is not there as it dips and then swings away. Lucky not to edge it

sensational bowling. New Zealand have burst through. Outswinger, outswinger, and then the scrambled-seam inswinger. This lands on a length, just outside off, and Vihari has got to be mindful of the outswinger. The ball, though, pitches and nips back in to go past his inside edge and knock him over
no he tries the inswinger, and Ashwin is equal to it, defending it just outside off
tries the full outswinger now, but he is a touch too straight, and Ashwin gets enough bat on it to take four runs to fine leg
wide on the crease, wide outside off, left alone
on a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
on a length, shaping away from off and middle, defended solidly off the front foot
bouncer to break that rhythm, Pant watches it sail through to the keeper
on a length, slides it down leg. Pant looks to get a touch but is beaten
on a length, this one nips back in a touch, but Pant has managed to drive this on the up to mid-on
short ball, chest high, keeps the pull down, gets a single
really wide ball, and Pant still has a go at it. Manages to send it only as far as short cover
really full, swinging back in, hits the inside half of the bat on the drive
on a length, extra bouncer, Pant has to check his drive, sends this towards mid-on
short ball that doesn't quite get up. And there is one thing with Pant: he won't miss out on these opportunities. Pulled in front of square
on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
Pant gets the width and he goes after it. It doesn't matter this is a top edge over the slips cordon. These are safe runs with no third man in place
short of a length, around off, defended to point
short of a length, at the hip, tucked away to leg gully. Along the ground
and tries the fuller lbw ball as Ashwin shuffles across. His bat comes down in time, though
again, really full, slight swing back in. Driven to mid-off this time
length ball, angling in, Ashwin moves across along the crease and defends
full, really full, swinging in, punch-driven to mid-off
full, outside off, Pant plays for the angle, but the ball swings back in and hits the inside edge of the bat
on a length, slight swing back in, defended back to him

and Ashwin has been done in by a full and straight delivery. Could he have reviewed this? I reckon he could have. He doesn't. This is full and straight, Ashwin is playing for the outswing, but it nips back in and hits him in front. I think there is a chance it has done too much, but Aleem Dar and Ashwin don't. Tracker shows clipping leg
this is definitely missing leg. Tries the yorker first up, and it swings in after itching leg. Ishant is off his feet as he tries to keep it out
short of a length, straight, defended to mid-on
full outswinger, Sharma gets behind it and opens the face on it. The ball rolls along to second slip
short of a length, into the body, keeps it out with one hand off the bat
short of a length, wide, crunched away, but they now have a deep point in place. So Pant turns down the single
another single turned down as this is tucked away off the hip
full, middle and off, defended back to him
Pant gets beaten. Lovely full awayswinger just outside off. He defends on the move, and nearly edges it
and he lets him get away with an easy single to fine leg. Pant keeps strike. Thoughts on asking that man to not field the ball and let it go for four so Southee can have a go at Sharma?
on a length, outside off, defended with soft hands
driven on the up but straight to mid-off
full, on the pads, placed wide enough of the sweeper on the leg side to be able to come back for two
bouncer from wide on the crease, easy to duck under as it is too short
mows this as if he is acing a spinner. The field has come up so he takes the boundary by sweeping Southee through midwicket
wide length ball to try to keep Pant at this end. Pant doesn't try any adventurous shot
full, swinging in, hits the pad, but it is missing leg
lovely shot from Sharma. On a knee, leaning into the wide full ball for a cover-drive. Gets two. Should have taken three
short of a length, Sharma shuffles across to defend this to leg. Keeps it down and in front of short leg
even better timing than the shot earlier. Full outside off, and he has driven it with a slightly open face of the bat to send it through cover-point for four. Does Pant stop farming the strike now?
short of a length, outside off, Sharma shuffles across to get behind it and defend

is that dropped?. Goes straight to short leg off the thigh pad, but the question is, is there an inside edge before the thigh pad? The replays show there is. And Tom Latham spills it. And he is not very close to the batsman either. That could have been Boult's five-for
starts with a bouncer, and Pant plays the ramp. This is slow off the surface so he doesn't send it all the way but clears the slips comfortably
short, middle and leg, pulled away, will get only a single to fine leg. Sharma is not looking forward to those sprinted couples
oh he tries that Boult-style mow after moving around in the crease. Is beaten by the shortish ball
that is the ball they are looking for. Short of a length, into the ribs/chest, and Sharma looks to fend. Except that he misses it down the leg side this time
looks for the pull this time, but is done in by the spongy bounce. Nowhere near touching it
short of a length, down the leg side, and he gets outside its line and shoulders arms
down the leg side, through to Watling
full, on the pads, clipped away to fine leg

another drop. What are New Zealand doing? Chipped nicely to short cover. Only slightly to his right, and he spills it. Has the ball come to him slower than Southee expects? He is filthy with himself. At least, in theory, both Southee and Boult can get five-fors still
defended to cover
full outswinger, which nips in a little, and goes off the inside edge for one
bouncer to keep Pant down at this end
back of a length, outside off. Ishant defends off the back foot. The ball lobs in the air, but falls short of the fielder at short gully
there's the lead for India as Ishant makes room and shellacks a horizontal-bat shot over extra cover. Not short enough to trouble India's tallest player
good length on middle, and following Ishant, who backed away far onto the leg side. Flicked to square leg
good length on off, and punched square to deep point. Doesn't take a run
good length on leg stump, and he swivels to top-edged the pull to the fine-leg fence
full, on off, and defended with soft hands towards cover
good length outside off stump. He covers his stumps and shoulders his arms

ball stays low and Ishant has been caught napping. Full on off, but it doesn't bounce as much and Ishant plays outside the line of the ball. Hits him in front of middle, and that is surely hitting middle and leg
back of a length on middle, and he gloves this to fine leg while trying to defend
length ball on off, and he throws his bat at this. Cut to cover point
short on middle, and he pulls along the ground to square leg
overpitched, wide outside off. Left alone. New ball due
full, outside off and Shami wants to thwack this away through the off side. Misses out, and through to Watling
full, on leg, and flicked off his toes to fine leg. Brings Pant back on strike

Boult 4, Southee 4 with the former taking a catch at deep backward square. Full on middle, and he slog sweeps behind square. Boult dives forward, takes the catch, and raises his thumb to confirm a clean catch
full on middle. Flicked towards midwicket. In the air, and falls short of Patel at midwicket
full, on off, and shaping away. Bumrah goes for a straight drive, misses, and he's lucky the ball moved so much that it missed the off stump as well

one handed catch at second slip! And Southee has five. Yorker outside off, Bumrah looks to dig it away, but it takes the edge and Mitchell dives to his right, sticks one hand out, and it stays in his palms! New Zealand need nine to win
full, from around the wicket. Defended
full outside off, and driven through the covers! NZ need five more to win
full outside off, and defended towards cover
full, on middle, and flicked off his pads to the gap near backward square. Bumrah - from fine leg - cuts it off
full and wide outside off, and he shoulders his arms
good length on middle, and angling into his pads. Misses the flick, ball hits his pads and rolls away to cover. They scamper across for the leg bye. Scores are tied
good length, outside off, and tapped to point. No chance of a run
good length, outside off, and tapped off the back foot to cover
good length, outside off, and punched to short cover
full, angling in, and flicked to fine leg. New Zealand win by ten wickets!
